dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE FLYING through mist, a dimly glimpsed forest below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was lying there in the VA hospital, with a big hole blown through the middle of my life, I started having these dreams of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are very low over the forest now, gliding fast, the dr BUILDING to a PEAK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later though, you always have to wake up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREECH OF BRAKES as a vehicle WIPES FRAME, revealing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SULLY, a scarred and scruffy combat vet, sitting in beat up carbon-fiber wheelchair. At 22, his eyes are hardened by the wisdom and wariness of one who has endure pain beyond his years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stares upward at the levels of the city. MAGLEV TRAI WHOOSH overhead on elevated tracks, against a sky of gari advertizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can fix a spinal, if you've got the money. But not on vet benefits, not in this economy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The traffic light changes and Jake pushes forward with th crowd, pumping the wheels of his chair. Most of the peopl wear FILTER MASKS to protect them from the toxic air. In LONG LENS STACK it is a marching torrent of anonymous, isolated souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a tiny CUBICLE, prison cell meets 747 bathroo Narrow cot, wall-screen droning away in the B.G. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bengal tiger, extinct for over a century, is making a comeback. These cloned tiger cubs at the Beijing Zoo are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake laboriously pulls his pants off -- rocking to one si pushing the fabric down past his hip, then rocking to the other, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His legs are white and atrophied. Utterly useless. But hi arms are tattooed and powerfully muscled. A "Born Loser" tattoo prominent on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I became a Marine for the hardship. To be hammered on the anvil of life. I told myself I could pass any test a man can pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake struggles with his pants a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the kind of place you'd bring your mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Jake near the pool table, BALANCING his chair, fr wheels off the ground, while holding a tequila shot on hi forehead. ONLOOKERS, including some other disabled vets, CLAP and WHOOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs the glass, SLAMS down the shot as they cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALL-SIZED SCREEN filled with the World Cup game -- men RUNNING on antelope legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE, watching what he can't have.    Expression stony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get it straight up front. I don't want your pity. I know the world's a cold-ass bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's eyes shift   -- HIS POV, seeing the bar through ga the crowd. A MAN    on a barstool SLAPS the WOMAN he's wi Hard. She cowers    but he's got her arm, shouting, raisi fist. An eternal    tableau. People look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE -- not looking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a fair deal, you're on the wrong planet. The strong prey on the weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JAKE'S HAND as he starts pushing the wheel of hi chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH HIM as he rolls forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the way things are.   And nobody does a damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stops, unnoticed, next to the bullying man. He leans down and grabs one leg of the man's barstool -- and YANKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair flips.   The guy goes down HARD and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE hurls himself from the wheelchair, toppling on the g getting a grip on him like a pit bull and PUNCHING the cr out of him, right there on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOUNCER jumps in, trying to drag him off and it goes SLOW MOTION, everybody yelling and pulling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I ever wanted in my sorry-ass life was a single thing worth fighting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BOUNCER hurls Jake out the door, sending him SPRAWLIN the pavement. A moment later, his chair CRASHES down on h banging across the alley, landing in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake struggles to rise on one elbow. He's bleeding and bruised, but still crazed and ready to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you realize you've just lost a customer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He collapses onto his back, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Candy ass bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares upwards at the levels of the city. MAGTRAINS RO overhead. It starts to RAIN. He just lies there, blinking then shouts jauntily to no one in particular --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it ain't rainin' we ain't trainin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK high and wide, as Jake lies spread-eagl amongst the trash, getting drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO LONG SHADOWS enter FRAME, coming to rest across him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sees two pairs of SHINY SHOES stop next to him.   He squints up at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN. Matching suits. Their features unremarkable and blandly threatening in the way of FBI agents and auditors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Jake Sully?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step off.    You're ruinin' my good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN-ANGLE on a large rectangular cardboard box. HANDS EN FRAME, pulling open the top to reveal a DEAD MAN'S FACE. looks EXACTLY like a clean-shaven version of Jake. His IDENTICAL TWIN -- TOMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strong prey on the weak. A guy with a knife took all Tommy would ever be, for the paper in his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, showing Jake and the two agents in a high tech CREMATORIUM -- a row of stainless steel furnaces. Jake stares down at his own face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Suits' concern was touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother represented a significant investment. We'd like to talk to you about taking over his contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ATTENDANT closes the box and seals it with a tape dispenser, like it's a package for shipping. The cardboar coffin is rolled into the furnace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The egghead and the jarhead.   Tommy was the scientist, not me. He was the one who wanted to get shot light years out into space to find the answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING IN ON JAKE as he watches, bathed in orange light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me -- I was just another dumb grunt gettin' sent someplace I was gonna regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE FURNACE the burners quickly eat away the cardboard; TOMMY'S FACE is, for a moment, wreathed in fla but not touched by it, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S FACE, in icy darkness. CLOSE ON his eyes -- they O suddenly, and he takes a sharp breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S POV -- the inside of a metal coffin. A SERVO WHINE and we are moving, emerging into a large chamber --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S POV -- A TECH in medical scrubs FLOATS WEIGHTLESSL toward us. Wherever we are, we're not on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake squints as the lights flicker on, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT -- the multi-tiered CRYO VAULT. Hundreds of CRY CAPSULES are opening like morgue drawers, as med techs pu themselves about in ZERO-G, tending to their patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hoarse whisper) Are we there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're there, Sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- SCORES OF PEOPLE emerge from their cryo-capsu in ZERO-G. Pale spirits of the dead rising from rows of o coffins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MED TECH floats among them, using his announcement vo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, you have been in cryo for five years, nine months and twenty two days. You will be hungry, you will be weak. If you feel nausea, please use the sacks provided for your convenience. The staff thanks you in advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING JAKE as he pushes away from his capsule, glidin the LOCKERS across the aisle, his paralyzed legs not an impediment in weightlessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against the cold infinity   of stars glides an INTERSTELL SPACECRAFT -- ISV VENTURE   STAR. As it moves past like a endless train, we realize   this thing is ENORMOUS -- ove a mile long. PAN WITH IT    180 to REVEAL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GAS-GIANT PLANET called POLYPHEMUS, ringed with dozens moons which cast beauty-mark shadows on its vast face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ISV diminishes away from us toward the largest MOON-- blue and surprisingly Earth-like world called PANDORA. Th ship dwindles to a speck against the BLUE MOON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISV Venture Star drifts above a spectacular vista -- the sapphire seas and unfamiliar continents of Pandora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ISV -- two massive "VALKYRIE" SHUTTLES are mated a DOCKING NODE. One of them separates from the starship a moves away, its thrusters FIRING in short bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shuttle moves away, descending toward Pandora, we the sound of DRUMS, building, louder and louder until we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING OVER A LANDSCAPE of massive cliffs and towering me carpeted in rainforest. Great scarves of cloud swirl arou the mesa tops. A primeval landscape, vast and forbidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees are alien, the color too cyan. There are waterfalls, rivers, and distant flocks of WINGED CREATURE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the carpet of virgin rainforest gives way to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN OPEN-PIT MINE. A lifeless crater -- as if a giant cook cutter took a chunk out of the world. Down among the terraces are EXCAVATORS and TRUCKS the size of three stor buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And beyond the mine is the HUMAN COLONY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELL'S GATE is a cluster of squat concrete and steel structures surrounded by chain-link FENCE 10 meters high, topped with razor wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the corners are towers with automated SENTRY GUNS swiveling on servo mounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible beyond the gun towers, the VALKYRIE SHUTTLE roars across the treetops. VECTORING NOZZLES change angle, bringing the ship to a SLOW HOVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a screen of jungle canopy, we see the VALKYRIE thunder overhead. Camera TILTS with it until leaves block the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUE INHUMAN HAND reaches INTO SHOT, parting the foliag reveal the shuttle hover-taxiing across the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE -- ECU of two intense, cat-like golden EYES watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW CHIEF stomps down the aisle yelling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exopacks on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers don their EXO-PACK breathing gear with practic moves. Everybody except JAKE, who's turning his this way that trying to figure out the straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember people, you lose your mask you're unconscious in 20 seconds and you're dead in four minutes. Let's nobody be dead today, it looks bad on my report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew chief stops by Jake long enough to bark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exopack on, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BENEATH THE SHUTTLE air blasts outward for a hundred mete radius as it settles onto its landing gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE everybody is queued up in the aisles, with duffles ready. Rows of tense, expectant faces in breathing masks and we DIP DOWN to find Jake, wheelchair putting him at t level of everyone else's WAISTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CARGO RAMP OPENS with a hydraulic whine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go directly into the base! Do not stop! Go straight inside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAND-HELD, running with the arriving colonists who double time down the ramp. They jog across the exposed apron tow a walkway covered in CHAINLINK which leads to the complex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the chain-link tunnel are a couple of SEC-OPS TROOPERS, CORPORAL LYLE WAINFLEET and PRIVATE FIKE. Sec-O is the colony's private security force. These guys are la back, hardened, and haggard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all that new meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEIR POV -- Jake rolls down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out, man.    Meals on wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, pumping his chair, looks around as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge TRACTOR, taller than a house, ROARS past on muddy wheels. He notices something sticking in the tires -- ARROWS. The neolithic weapons are jarring amid all the advanced technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the tractor, two VTOL vehicles take off. Armored a heavily armed, they are AT-99 "SCORPION" GUNSHIPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MITSUBISHI MK-6 AMPSUITS -- human operated walking machin meters tall -- patrol the perimeter. They are heavily armored, and armed with a huge rotary cannon called a GAU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the outer fence stands a black wall of forest hund of feet high.   A SENTRY GUN OPENS FIRE from a tower. TRA light up the twilight. A shadowy SHAPE SHRIEKS and drops the fence. It is an armed camp in a state of siege.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAINFLEET and Fike give Jake and his chair the hairy eyeb as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you two limpdicks starin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake rolls past, SOMETHING SWOOPS down behind him and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-KRASH! SMASHES against the chain-link right next to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vicious AERIAL PREDATOR a meter across gnashes glass fa against the steel. It STABS at him through the chain link with a tail ending in a glistening stiletto. A STINGBAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAINFLEET casually BLASTS IT with his PISTOL.   It drops the fence, tail still lashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen a lotta guys leave this place in a wheelchair. Never seen anybody show up in one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stares at the gnashing fangs of the dying alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A WALKWAY of the OPS CENTER, seen from above, a UNIFOR FIGURE grips the railing, watching Jake pump his chair through the tunnel below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hair is clipped short. The scalp is etched by long parallel SCARS where some Pandoran denizen's claws raked across it. The bare arms, below tightly rolled sleeves, s hewn out of some hard tropical wood. Criss-crossed by sca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN raises his masked face to look at the sky.    He are an icy steel gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV -- the mighty POLYPHEMUS seems to fill the sky, beyond the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not in Kansas any more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MAN from the balcony -- COLONEL MILES QUARITCH -- is HEAD OF SECURITY for the Hell's Gate colony. A hundred ne arrivals watch raptly as he paces like a panther across t front of the large cafeteria. He stops, stance wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without his mask, we see that Quaritch's features are rug and handsome, except for the SCAR, which runs from scalp jaw down one side of his face. On one hip he carries a ve large PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You are on Pandora, ladies and gentlemen. Respect that fact every second of every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE ROLLS IN, watching from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL QUARITCH raises his hand and points out the windo toward the dark treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out beyond that fence every living thing that crawls, flies or squats in the mud wants to kill you and eat your eyes for jujubees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room gets very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an indigenous population of humanoids here called the Na'vi. They're fond of arrows dipped in a neurotoxin which can stop your heart in one minute. We operate -- we live -- at a constant threat condition yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS the solid faces of miners, Cat-machine drivers engineers, geologists, as they take that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As head of security, it's my job to keep you alive.    I will not succeed -- (pausing for effect) -- not with all of you. If you wish to survive, you need a strong mental attitude, you need to follow procedure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON JAKE, watching as the briefing continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like an old-school safety brief to put your mind at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are roaming in both directions, looking for rooms, lugging duffels and cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eager young XENOANTHROPOLOGIST, staggering under an overpacked duffel, runs to catch up to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're Jake right? Tom's brother? You look just like him. (off Jake's wary look) Sorry, I'm Norm Spellman, I went through avatar training with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm offers his hand and Jake shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a great guy -- funny.     It was a big shock to all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pumps the wheels of his chair, rolling on.       Nor with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And duh! -- obviously you look like him. I mean, if you weren't genetically identical, you wouldn't be taking over his avatar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- you want to go check it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE AND NORM enter the BIO-LAB -- a large lab complex wi many adjoining rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Norm were out here to drive these remotely controlled bodies called avatars. They're grown from human DNA mixed with DNA from the natives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scientist, DOCTOR MAX CULLIMORE, is supervising the uncrating of two SHIPPING CONTAINERS. The nearer has the sides removed, revealing -- a ceiling-height acrylic TANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm stops to stare, and Jake rolls past him as if drawn some unseen force, toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AMNIO TANK. There is a FIGURE floating lanquidly insi which looks like a man. A very large, very blue, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood circulates through a synthetic UMBILICAL in the abdomen. As the figure turns in the amniotic fluid, we se that it has a lemur-like TAIL. The skin is cyan-blue. Lon black hair drifts, graceful as seaweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   They got big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they mature on the trip out. (to Max) So the proprioceptive sims worked pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they've got great muscle tone. Give us a few hours, you guys can take them for a spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FIGURE'S sleeping face turns toward us, and the featu are -- despite feline ears and a long feral snout -- definitely JAKE'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it looks like you.   This is your avatar now, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, mesmerized as he stares into the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea is -- every driver is matched to his own avatar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEREOCAM VIDEO SHOT OF JAKE -- facing the camera, talkin directly to the lens. JAKE'S VOICE-OVER up until now has been part of this VIDEOLOG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so their nervous systems are in tune. Or something. Which is why they offered me this gig, because I can link with Tommy's avatar, which was insanely expensive. (looking off camera) Is this right? I just say whatever in these videologs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, showing Norm working nearby with Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You just need to get in the habit of documenting everything -- what you see, what you feel -- it's all part of the science. Good science starts with good observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (to camera) So, whatever. Here I am. Doing science. (looks around) Never been in a lab before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Log off. It's time to meet your boss for the next five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Jake and Norm through the short corridor to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LINK ROOM contains a dozen PSIONIC LINK UNITS, which like coffins crossed with MRI scanners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace Augustine is a legend. She's the head of the Avatar Program, and she wrote the book -- I mean literally wrote the book -- on Pandoran botany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, over his shoulder) That's because she likes plants better than people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. GRACE AUGUSTINE sits up in her link, stretching and cracking her neck after a long session. She's fifty, with strong face and fiercely intelligent eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (YELLING) Who's got my goddamn cigarette?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECH scurries to bring it to her, already lit.   Around they jump when Grace barks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stands, scowling, as Jake, Norm and Max approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here she is, Cinderella back from the ball. Grace, I'd like you to meet Norm Spellman and Ja --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm. I hear good things about you. How's your Na'vi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Na'vi, subtitled) May the All Mother smile upon our first meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace nods approvingly, taking a drag on her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Not bad. You sound a little formal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) There is still much to learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake waits while they ignore him, chattering in fluent Na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Grace, this is Jake S----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Jake) Yeah, yeah, I know who you are, and I don't need you. I need your brother. (to Max) You know -- the PhD who trained three years for this mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. I know it's a big inconvenience to everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much lab training have you had?   Ever run a gas chromatograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any actual lab work at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High school chemistry.   But I ditched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace wheels on Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? You see? They're pissing on us without even the courtesy of calling it rain. (turning away) I'm going to Selfridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves past Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, that's not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's already out the door and clomping down the corridor. Max turns to Jake with a pained look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, tomorrow, oh eight hundred.   Try to use big words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like an air-traffic control tower, with lots of screens and bay windows showing the whole complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADMINISTRATOR PARKER SELFRIDGE takes a ball from a newly opened case of TITLEISTS and sets it on the floor. Selfri is young, charismatic, focused. Some would say ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He assumes the stance and lines up his putt, toward a practice cup across the control room floor. He glances up Grace strides toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I used to think it was benign neglect, but now I see you're intentionally screwing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace.   You know I enjoy our little talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a research assistant, not some jarhead dropout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge looks down and hits the ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace kicks the practice cup aside, and the ball rolls pa Selfridge looks at her with a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we got lucky with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky?   How is this in any way lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Selfridge saunters over to retrieve the ball --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- lucky your guy had a twin brother, and lucky the brother wasn't an oral hygienist or something. A Marine we can use. I'm assigning him to your team as security escort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I need is another trigger happy asshole out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're supposed to be winning the hearts and minds of the natives. Isn't that the whole point of your little puppet show? If you look like them, if you talk like them, they'll trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge crosses to his office, behind a glass wall near Grace follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But after -- how many years? -- relations with the indigenous are only getting worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tends to happen when you use machine guns on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Selfridge's desk is a magnetic base, and hovering in m air, in the invisible field, is a lump of METALLIC ROCK. Pure UNOBTANIUM. He grabs it and holds it up between thum and forefinger, in front of Grace's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why we're here. Unobtanium. Because this little gray rock sells for twenty million a kilo. No other reason. This is what pays for the party. And it's what pays for your science. Comprendo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places it back in the magnetic field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those savages are threatening our whole operation. We're on the brink of war and you're supposed to be finding a diplomatic solution. So use what you've got and get me some results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEXT MORNING, GRACE, NORM and JAKE approach their link un

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake glances through a PRESSURE WINDOW. In an adjoining chamber (the AMBIENT ROOM) JAKE'S AVATAR lies on a gurney breathing slowly in PANDORAN AIR. NORM'S AVATAR is on a second gurney. Both are attended by med techs in exo-mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm slips into his LINK CHAIR, expertly donning biometri sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much link time have you logged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred and twenty hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace looks pointedly at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like -- an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you're joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace opens the hood of Jake's link unit. Jake starts hauling himself across from his wheelchair. She reaches t help him but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!   I got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace steps back, hands raised.    He drags himself into unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just figured you'd come out here to the most hostile environment known to man, with no training of any kind, and see how it went? What was going through your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He meets her eyes with a defiant glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was just tired of doctors telling me what I couldn't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches him laboriously pull his inert legs into th link chair by hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake settles into the warm fluid gel packs lining the uni It seems to enfold him. Grace adjusts his biometric senso then lowers the UPPER CLAMSHELL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax and let your mind go blank.    That shouldn't be hard for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss the darkest part of my lily white --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the SLAMMING HOOD muffles the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Initiate link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LINK TECH touches some controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A LARGE MONITOR a 3D SCAN of Jake's brain appears. Regions of activity flow with complex shifting colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a gorgeous brain.     Nice activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go figure. (walking away) Alright, I'm going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase-lock at forty percent.    He's in transition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max watches a display showing the avatar's nervous system aligning with Jake's -- two ghostly networks of light merging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.     Find your way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU JAKE, inside the link unit. His eyes move under the lids, like a dreamer in REM sleep as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE JAKE'S MIND -- radiant streamers coalesce into a pulsing TUNNEL OF LIGHT and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SCREEN FLARES WHITE -- ZZZWHAP! -- resolving into an overexposed, out-of-focus image -- two BLURRY FACES weari masks, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU JAKE'S AVATAR -- two very intense eyes FILL FRAME, th pupils contracting. Golden irises pulse with life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phase-lock ninety nine percent. The link is stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinking, Jake slowly sits up on the gurney. He looks dow at his AVATAR BODY, touching his chest with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it slow, Jake. We need to check your motor control. Try touching your fingertips together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jake isn't listening. He's staring at his legs.     H eases them off the gurney and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS BLUE FEET touch the concrete floor, taking his weight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE STANDS, feeling the strength in his legs.    His expression is child-like with wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV -- looking down at the med techs, who seem the si of children next to his 9' tall frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees something like a blue tentacle curl across his ar and he JERKS AROUND in alarm. HIS TAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns to see it, the tail sweeps instruments off a table with a crash. Jake laughs and grins at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Jake, I need you to sit down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jake takes a step, then another. The wires to the bio monitors pull taut, and he yanks them off his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake! Wait, we have to run some tests --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jake pushes past the protesting med techs, toward the door and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake emerges, blinking in the morning sun. He finds himse in the AVATAR COMPOUND -- a living and training area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, a couple of AVATARS are playing one-on-one in fro of a (non-regulation height) basketball net. Others go ab their daily activities around the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake flexes his legs -- JUMPS -- and lands a little unsteadily, but his expression is joyful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps and breaks into a RUN. People are calling to him, somehwere, but he doesn't hear them -- he running. RUNNING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds himself in the COMPOUND GARDEN, and stops amid neatly tended rows of ALIEN PLANTS. He looks down, wiggli his toes in the warm soil. Then inhales deeply -- revelli in the alien smells -- earth, plants, the nearby forest. looks at his bare footprint in the soil of an alien world

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Marine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns at the familiar voice to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A statuesque FEMALE AVATAR walking toward him. AVATAR GRA is magnificent, with panther thighs, flat muscular stomac and firm athlete's breasts. She wears shorts and a T-shir In human years she would be about 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well who'd you expect, numbnuts?   Think fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws him a piece of Pandoran fruit, which he catche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motor control is looking good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake bites into the fruit, the juice running down his chi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns to see NORM'S AVATAR posing like a bodybuilder chest shot, back shot, bi's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a living god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WIDE SHOT of the terraced crater of the UNOBTANIUM MINE quiet beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-WHOOOOM! The entire face of one terrace is blown skywar in a chain of EXPLOSIONS. The "shot" blasts hundreds of t of rock loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS ANGLES of enormous WHEEL-LOADERS shovelling up rich rock and dropping it into DUMP TRUCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of steel FILLS FRAME. The DOZER BLADE crushes everything in its path, reducing trees to kindling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER, showing the CLEAR-CUTTING operation near the mine, a road is cut through the jungle. Remotely operated DOZER three stories tall rip into the tree-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the dozers has rotating SLASH-CUTTER, a vicious spinning head, mounted on a hydraulic arm, that hogs thro the enormous tree trunks in a spray of wood-shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy machines are escorted by AMPSUITS. COLONEL QUARITCH, on foot, leads a squad of troopers wearing breathing masks and carrying almighty big AUTOMATIC WEAPO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANSHEE -- a fearsome aerial predator -- HURTLES from above, diving toward them on wings 3 meters across. We ge glimpse of glassy fangs before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-P-POOM! Quaritch cranks off three rapid SHOTS with his massive sidearm, and the creature drops with a SHRIEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It crashes near them and Quaritch FIRES two more well pla rounds. The newbies stare at the thing's barracuda teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you pogues, this is a banshee. A small one. See, they like it when I bring fresh meat out here. And this clearcutting really stirs up the hornet's nest. So keep your head on a swivel. If it moves, shoot it. If you're not sure it's moving -- shoot it! If it looks like a bunch of flowers you want to take home to Sally Rottencrotch -- SHOOT IT! What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot it, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding. Let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch leads his squad into the gloom of the forest, hi eyes scanning. Flanking the squad, LYLE WAINFLEET drives AMPSUIT, his massive feet CRASHING through the underbrush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his gaze comes down, he sees something ahead of him on trail -- an intricate TOTEM of woven sticks, bones and feathers hanging across the trail like an orb-weaver's we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears it down with the barrel of his rifle, and stomps into the mud as he moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits on a wooden bed in a long hut of tropical-style construction -- beamed ceiling, open sides covered by scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around him the other avatars are bedding down for the nig pulling insect netting around their cots. In one hand, Ja holds the end of his long braided QUEUE of hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the queue -- the ends of the hair writhe slowly their own life, like tendrils of a sea creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kinda freaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE switches off the overheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out amigos.     See ya' at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits in the twilight, listening to the SCREECHES and HOOTS from the forest. Finally he lies down, CLOSING HIS EYES and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU HUMAN JAKE -- his eyes OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake blinks, disoriented, as Max opens the upper clamshel his link unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next chair Grace sits up, yawning and cracking her neck as the scared tech runs to her with a lit cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down) Damn. Same old sack a' bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE struggles with the dead weight of his legs as he hau himself out of the unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE sits with GRACE, NORM and the other avatar "drivers" while around them miners, troopers and other base personn wolf their breakfasts. Grace is engaged in a heated conversation with another SCIENTIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, isolated from the conversations around him, notices

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT TRUDY CHACON approaching, dressed in her flight sui She's a rock-hard former Marine with thousands of flight hours out in the badlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sully -- Colonel wants to see you in the Armor Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gives Norm a puzzled glance and pivots from the tabl He wheels away, led by Trudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON GRACE, scowling as she watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE AND TRUDY enter the ARMOR BAY, passing TILT-ROTORS u repair. There are the heavily armed SCORPIONS as well as several SA-2 SAMSON work-horses outfitted with door guns rocket pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys're packing some heavy ordinance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, `cause we're not the only thing flyin' around out there. Or the biggest. I'm gonna need you on a door gun, I'm a man short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extends her fist and he taps it with his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya on the flight-line, zero nine. (she points) He's down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake rolls his chair along the central gallery of the Arm Bay, passing rows of AMPSUITS standing in service racks. Techs clamber over the `suits, loading ordinance with cra and lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the row is a makeshift GYM area.   QUARITCH bench-pressing massive plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This low gravity makes you soft. (pushing the last rep) You get soft, Pandora will shit you out dead with zero warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch racks the bar and sits up, sweating but not wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled your record, Corporal. Venezuela -- that was some mean bush. Nothing like this here, though. You got heart kid, coming out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured -- just another hellhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch chuckles appreciatively, claps him on the should The CHIEF MECHANIC yells from the nearest AMPSUIT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That servo's in, Colonel, if you want to try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch crosses to the `suit, with Jake following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in First Recon a few years ahead of you. More than a few. Two tours in Nigeria, not a scratch. I come out here and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to his scarred face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could fix this if I rotated back. But you know what? I kinda like it. Reminds me every day what's out there. Besides, I can't leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks out, as if he can see through the wall to the tr line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my war, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch climbs the `suit and reaches into the cockpit, throwing some switches. The `suit's gas-turbine spools up with a rising WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The avatar program is a joke -- buncha limpdick scientists. But we have a unique opportunity here, you and I. A recon Marine in an avatar body could get me the intel I need, on the ground, right in the hostiles' camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHINE is now a roaring WHOOSH as the `suit trembles w power. The air boils above the exhaust vents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch reaches in and operates the controls, flexing on huge hand. He nods to the waiting mechanic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks good. (to Jake) I need you to learn about these savages, gain their trust. Find out how I can force their cooperation, or hit `em hard if they don't. Maybe you can keep some of my boys from going home like you. Or bagged-and-tagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NODDING) That sounds real good, Colonel.   So -- am I still with Augustine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On paper. You walk like one of her science pukes, you quack like one, but you report to me. Can you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake nods. Quaritch brings the `suit to life. He steps forward and pivots smoothly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He balances the two ton machine on one foot while sweepin the arms in strong, graceful arcs. Jake realizes he is do a WU-SHOO KATA. A flawless display of strength and contro He's impressive, and Jake is impressed. Quaritch is the k of man he respects -- focused, hard. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, son -- I take care of my own. Get me what I need, I'll see you get your legs back when you rotate home. Your real legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the `suit's hand, and slams the canopy shut lik the visor of a helmet. Jake watches Quaritch walk past, h feet CLANGING -- KUNG! KUNG! KUNG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE is on the move, gulping coffee, in a hurry to get t FIRST SORTIE started. She hands a clipboard to MAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start calibrating. We're on the flight line in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods and jogs ahead toward the LINK ROOM. JAKE and NO fall in with Grace as they enter the CONNECTING CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Atilla want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Marines comparin' tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Yeah. Well, listen to me, Marine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, turning to drill him with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you're driving an avatar, now.     That means you're in my world, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and enters the LINK ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace crosses to the controls of Jake's LINK UNIT. As the others catch up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That son of a bitch has screwed up this program enough. All this -- (indicating link room) -- exists so we can go out there and build a bridge of trust to these people, who could teach us so much. But thanks to Quaritch and his thugs the Na'vi won't even talk to us anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how's this supposed to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a new face. (turning to Norm) You're fluent, you've studied the culture. You're non-threatening. The ones we know best -- the Omaticaya clan -- may give you a chance. Maybe you can get them back to the table before things go tits-up for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is failing as a pep talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake hauls himself across from wheelchair to link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we contact them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't. They contact us. If they see us taking our samples, treating the forest with respect -- (pointedly to Jake) Not trampling everything in sight -- they may reach out to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or they may skin us and make a drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake lies back, lowering the sensor array over his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your mouth shut and let Norm do the talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes his clamshell, HARD, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING over a carpet of rainforest, past sheer cliffs and cloud-wreathed mesas. TRUDY'S SAMSON TILT-ROTOR chases it shadow across the treetops. Though big as a Blackhawk, it tiny in the vast primeval landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE THROUGH the open side doors of the Samson. Trooper WAINFLEET, in exo-mask and body armor, leans on his door scanning for aerial predators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In avatar form JAKE, GRACE and NORM watch the forest unrolling beneath them, the wind blasting their clothes. Jake mans the other door gun, his feet propped on the ski

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY flies from a pressurized cockpit. She banks to foll shallow river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sturmbeest herd, one o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm grins and points, excitedly. Jake looks in time to s A herd of STURMBEEST -- massive six-legged creatures reminiscent of buffalo -- thundering across the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a bull, six cows and some juveniles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull has the red on the dorsal armor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace nods approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- Hundreds of purple winged creatures take flig from a lake, startled by the Samson. They skim the water above their own reflections. TETRAPTERONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- the ground drops away as the Samson flies ove WATERFALL hundreds of feet high. Trudy banks hard, rollin in on the gorge below like it's a gun-run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wainfleet WHOOPS while Norm looks like he's about to puke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo Chacon!     Get some!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grins into the airstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small meadow among towering trees. The fern-like "grass is beaten down in waves by the rotor-wash as the Samson settles to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls the massive door gun off its pintle mount and hefts it like an assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Wainfleet leap out to secure the LZ, scanning the line warily, weapons aimed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace jogs forward to the cockpit, motioning Trudy to shu down. Trudy kills the Samson's TURBINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, towering over Wainfleet, motions him to hang back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with the ship. (for Jake) One idiot with a gun's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes point as they enter the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) Ya'll have fun out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forest engulfs JAKE, GRACE and NORM in cyan gloom. Th shadows are alive with the CHITTERING sounds of unseen al wildlife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH JAKE as he moves through the foliage, hyper alert -- looking around like a tourist in Hell.A monkey-l PROLEMURIS leaping from limb to limb overhead, flashing through the sunlight streaming down in shafts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PLANT with swaying tendrils which reach toward Jake as passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This forest is more alive than any on Earth, with plants react and move like animals. Jake white-knuckles his rifl as if every shadow conceals razor-fanged death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Marine. You're making me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes ahead of him on the trail, forcing him to lowe his muzzle as he follows her. Grace moves nimbly on the path, seemingly unconcerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as the party moves between the huge trees, tiny ants. The trail has gotten steeper, the going tougher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a clearing with an OVERGROWN BUILDING made of timbers cut from the local trees, with a thatch roof. It covered with vines as the jungle reclaims it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will they know we're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they're watching us right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm gulps. Jake looks behind him as they approach the school, feeling unseen eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH JAKE'S BOOTS as he steps among dried leaves a few moldering CHILDREN'S BOOKS. Floorboards CREAK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids were so bright, so eager to learn... they picked up English faster than I could teach it to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER as Jake explores the room. Grace and Norm are selec INSTRUMENTS from storage cases on a wooden table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the soil probe -- right there, yellow case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks up at a RUSTLING among the dark rafters. Roost STINGBATS eye him warily, fluttering their wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace picks up a moldering copy of "The Lorax" by Dr. Seu from the floor and puts it back on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WISTFULLY) The stingbats knock them off. I guess I always hope somebody will come back and read them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GRIMLY) The Na'vi learned as much about us as they needed to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sees something, and approaches the blackboard -- rea out to touch a pattern of holes blasted into the slate. Unmistakably BULLET HOLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to her) What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHARPLY) Are you going to help with this gear? We've got a lot to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away.   Jake watches her as he jams equipment i his pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Grace's blue hand gently brushing away soil, exposing a tangle of ROOT TENDRILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, right here where the roots of the two trees interact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER -- GRACE and NORM crouch among enormous octopoidal roots. She takes a tiny sample using a needle-like probe. Norm uses a digital DEVICE to scan the roots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, bored, scouts ahead a few meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to a GLADE filled with shoulder-high SPIRAL PLAN called HELICORADIANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BRUSHES one and SHTOONK! -- it SUCKS DOWN into a tube the ground so quickly it seems to simply vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Jake touches another -- SHTOONK! And another -- like popping balloons after a party. SHTOONK! SHTOONK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chain reaction begins and the whole colony pulls down i the ground, REVEALING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAMMERHEAD TITANOTHERE. Like a six-legged rhinoceros, b twice that size. Its massive, low-slung head has projecti of bone giving it the look of a hammerhead shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its baleful eyes lock onto him.   Jake raises his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace, alerted by the creature's SNORTS, runs to where sh can see the tableau. She presses her THROAT MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot. You'll piss it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull HAMMERHEAD bellows and lowers its 3 meter wide sledgehammer of a skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already pissed off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, that armor's too thick. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake starts to back away.   The hammerhead bellows again, pawing the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a territorial threat display. Do not run, or he'll charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammerhead SLASHES its head sideways, splintering saplings. It bellows again, lowers its head and CHARGES -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake SCREAMS at the top of his lungs, spreads his arms wi and runs straight at the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It STOPS abruptly, with an oversized BLEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE -- amazed the gambit worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah!   Who's bad?! That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING rises up behind him out of focus --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THANATOR. The most awesome land predator the universe h ever conceived This thing could eat a T-rex and have the Alien for desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a black six-limbed panther from Hell, with an armor head and massive distensible jaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, unaware of the advancing thanator, is still bracing hammerhead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talkin' about, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull wheels around, TRUMPETING in fear, and CRASHES a through splintering undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right motherf--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guttural SNARL behind him. Jake spins in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE TONS of rippling thanator LAUNCH over him, landing between him and the hammerhead. The ground shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thanator emits an earsplitting ROAR, enraged that the hammerhead got away. It twists on itself, turning to face Jake, and bares its fangs with a lethal HISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this one?       Run, don't run? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run.     Definitely RUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake BOLTS as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thanator LEAPS after him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake launches himself between two large trunks, forcing t beast to claw its way around to the side while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scrambles up -- around -- over a tangle of roots and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SK-RASH!! CLAWS SLASH the air behind him, EXPLODING bark a trunk as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE wills himself forward in a frenzy. With rippling mus the beast is airborne again, blacking out the sun but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE dives under a massive root system, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Kindling rains around him as the beast tears into root-trunks above him. Claws SLASH down next to him as he rolls and crawls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glistening jaws SMASH and SNAP against the barrier trunks sending chunks of wood flying. It's spittle sprays across Jake, jaws inches away as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls onto his back, and FIRES his AR point blank but rifle is SNATCHED out of his hands. The beast SCREECHES a ungodly WAIL of pain and rage and -- RIPS the ENTIRE TRUN away. Jake scrambles to escape but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISTENING JAWS lunge downward, SNAP SHUT and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature rips Jake out of the tree, shaking him like junkyard dog with a rabbit, only --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has him by the BACKPACK, so Jake unlatches it and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FLIES FREE as the thanator crushes the pack with its teeth. Giving Jake a moment to sprint away, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a hideous BELLOW the thanator crashes after him, splintering trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE RUNS in a blur, dodging between trunks as a glisteni black tornado shreds the forest behind him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees WATER ahead and DIVES OUTWARD with all his might

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thanator's jaws SNAP SHUT inches behind him as he fli out into open space and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SPLASHES down into a swiftly moving river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thanator LEAPS DOWN AFTER HIM, pursuing from rock to rock, its claws swiping like a grizzly fishing for salmon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ducks under as -- FWHOOSH! -- black claws SLASH past his face amid turbulent bubbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WATERFALL ahead. Jake is swept over the falls, with the thanator SWIPING at him from a rock, just MISSING and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake disappears down the throat of the thundering catarac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water boils below the cataract. Jake's head bursts through the surface, and he gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is carried along by the current, but manages to grab a limb on a fallen tree. He weakly pulls himself up, and ju lies there gasping on the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above him, on the cliff, the THANATOR BELLOWS, a roar whi echoes across the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, wet and bruised, crouches under a screen of giant leaves.   He hacks manically at the end of a cut sapling his knife, forming a crude but sharp tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING with Jake as he walks through the forest like it minefield, carrying his SPEAR white-knuckled. He is freak and hyper-alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees here are a hundred meters high, blocking out th sky. A few pencil beams of sunlight filter down into the cyan gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV FROM ABOVE -- looking down through leaves we watch Ja move warily through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU -- TWO GOLDEN EYES, bright in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWNANGLE as Jake passes under a tree limb. Invisible to him, draped on the limb like a leopard, is a striking NA' GIRL. She watches, only her eyes moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is lithe as a cat, with a long neck, muscular shoulde and nubile breasts. And she is devastatingly beautiful -- for a girl with a tail. In human age she would be 18. Her name is NEYTIRI(nay-Tee-ree).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake passes less than 2 meters beneath her, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI rises soundlessly. In one fluid, sinuous movement she NOCKS an arrow to her BOW and DRAWS, aiming RIGHT AT JAKE. Utterly silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below her Jake is totally unaware of the arrow aimed at h THROAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NEYTIRI as she follows him with the bow, muscles tensi for the shot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and SOMETHING drifts down in front of her, F.G.    She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACK FOCUS to the tip of the arrow -- where a single WOODSPRITE floats down to land on the arrow-head.Like a dandelion seed, but larger, the WOODSPRITE waves its silk CILIA, feather light, as it balances on the deadly point. glows faintly in the dark shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI frowns, puzzled, and LOWERS her bow slowly.   The woodsprite WHIRLS away into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE and NORM peer down into the shadowed forest as TRUD banks in a search pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to call it, guys. We're not allowed to run night ops. Colonel's orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace looks to the west.    The sun setting behind alien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Doc. He's just gonna have to hang on `till morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to make it till morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stares into the dark forest as the Samson banks har thundering away toward the setting sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS-- POLYPHEMUS. The giant planet rises behind the black trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's got a new problem. He sees shapes moving with liqu grace in the NIGHT shadows behind him. He is being stalke a pack of VIPERWOLVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake catches only glimpses -- a glint of eyes, a slinking black movement -- then nothing. Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- TIGHT ON Jake's hands as he knots his T-shirt around the butt end of the spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THICK SAP trickling down a tree-trunk. Jake jams the makeshift torch into the sap, soaking the shirt with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WATERPROOF MATCH from his survival kit lights the torch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torch creates a pool of light surrounded by pulsing, leaping shadows. Jake turns warily as he moves along the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him are several pairs of reflective green EYES. Another pair flanking him beside the trail. Black-on-blac SHAPES which seem to flow like liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up -- sees one cross a limb overhead.   Another his opposite flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a hideous sound, like a hyena's psychotic LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIPERWOLVES can run like a dog and climb like a monke They are hunting Jake from the ground and the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE RUNS by torch-light, on the edge of panic. He reache steep banked stream and -- without thinking -- runs acros on a horizontal trunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and STOPS DEAD on the other side. The torch illuminate GREEN EYES cutting ahead of him across the trail. The viperwolves have him encircled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The psychotic BARKS become more intense as they signal ea other, getting excited. ONE MAKES A RUN at him, angling o his legs from behind but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE WHIRLS, jamming the torch in its face.   It yips and past, but ANOTHER moves in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jabs it with the business end of the spear and it SNAR retreating, baring its fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now half a dozen are circling him in the open, and he see what he's up against.   The VIPERWOLVES are six-limbed wi shiny chitinous skin, their paws leathery BLACK HANDS. Intelligent eyes. Glistening black teeth in dead white gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake realizes that he is making his final stand.   He whi the torch in an arc, keeping them at bay --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And feels a rush of adrenaline. It goes through him like lightning bolt and the fear is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SCREAMING) I don't have all goddamn night! Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With snarls and a blur of motion THEY ATTACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake CRACKS the spear down on one, then SPINS as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER LEAPS at him and he plants the spear in it, strik true, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its momentum wrenches it from his hands, and the torch go flying. Left in semi-darkness, Jake draws his KNIFE as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOLF LUNGES, sinking its teeth into his arm. He YELLS i pain and fury, SLASHING with the knife which --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUTS deep into the beast's shoulder and it lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SPRINTS, trying to escape, but a snarling viperwolf leaps, GRABBING him by the ankle with its fore-hand. Jake tears away, sprawling, SCRAMBLING to get up as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE WOLVES charge at once.     The nearest LEAPS at his just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK!! -- an ARROW appears in its chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolf lands on him, already a dead weight.    He pushe off in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUE AMAZON emerge from the trees, nock another arrow, and FIRE in one fluid motion. AN UNEARTHLY YOWL as anothe wolf falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI LEAPS right over Jake, and CRACKS her bow down on skull of a circling wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SPRINGS at her and she drops under its weight, bu rolls, coming up on top of it with a knife in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her knife FLASHES down, buried to the hilt in its chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNARLING, a wounded wolf attacks Jake, and he KICKS it aw but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It SPINS and leaps back onto him, and Jake barely catches throat in time to keep the SNAPPING JAWS away from his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEANWHILE Neytiri swings her bow in a big arc, CRACKING I across the heads and shoulders of two remaining wolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrreeyaaah! Hyaaaah!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wolves slink and circle, yelping as the bow whistles them. Finally they break and run, with Neytiri chasing an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bound away through the foliage as she SHOUTS after t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaaarrrr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake has his adversary pinned and is choking it with all weight. Finally it stops thrashing. Panting, he releases and looks up at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI. Her tail LASHES as she scans the forest, listeni to the fading YELPS of the wolves. Satisfied the attack i over, she turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards him coldly for a second, then walks past him. Neytiri picks up the torch and extinguishes it in a strea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake blinks around at the darkness -- realizing he can st see. In fact, with the blinding torchlight gone, the fore is transformed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jungle has come alive with BIOLUMINESCENCE -- spots a patterns, ghosts and galaxies of blue-green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scrambles to recover his spear.   Neytiri kneels bes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DYING WOLF. It's CRIES are pitiful. It paws the air, trying to raise its head. She pulls her KNIFE from its chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Na'vi) Forgive me, my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts its throat, ending the pitiful cries. She touche its head gently, regarding it with sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri wipes the knife and returns it to the sheath at h waist. She crosses to another slain wolf and kneels, pull the arrow from its heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, um, I know you probably don't understand this. But -- thanks. Thank you. I owe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri ignores him, assuming a prayer posture over the d animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Na'vi) Forgive me. May your spirit run with the Great Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have been screwed if you hadn't come along --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and walks away without looking at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait. Wait!   Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crashes through some plants, catching up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down a second will you. I just want to thank you for killing those --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes the mistake of grasping her shoulder and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! She WALLOPS him upside the head with her bow in a fierce backhand swing, laying him out flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see a FURY standing over him. A Fury who speaks English -- accented, halting, angry English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank! You don't thank for this! This is sad. Very sad, only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm sorry.    Whatever I did -- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures at the bodies of the viperwolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this is your fault! They did not need to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They attacked me.   How'm I the bad guy HERE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She silences him with the tip of her bow at his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fault! You are like a baby, making noise, don't know what to do. You should not come here, all of you! You only come and make problems. Only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gets up, slowly, facing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, you love your little forest friends. So why not just let them kill my ass? What's the thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU Neytiri -- looking away. Finally, reluctantly, her eye MEET HIS for the first time -- a riveting gaze with those gold orbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why save you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, why save me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a strong heart.   No fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But stupid! Ignorant like a child!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away, stalking off, but Jake goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH Neytiri as she climbs nimbly along a huge R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER as she trots with perfect balance along the root, w forms an elevated walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake runs to catch up, realizing suddenly that he is far above the forest floor. Throughout the following they mov through a GLOWING PHANTASMAGORICAL FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm so ignorant, maybe you should teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sky people can not learn.   You do not See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaps to another elevated root.   Jake follows, surpr that he made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooaa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs to catch up with her easy jogging pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then teach me to "see."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops and he almost runs into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can teach you to See.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she turns and trots on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run across the elevated root of an enormous tree -- horizontal trunk big as an oak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as they cross a DEEP GORGE. A waterfall shimmer silver in the Polyphemus-light. Vines hang down a hundred feet into the gorge, and among them swoop stingbats and o night flyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, slow down. Look, I think we just got off on the wrong foot and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks down, suddenly aware of the height.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you just have to get to know me. I'm Jake. Jake Sull--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vine catches his spear and spins him off balance.   He the spear and almost falls off the root.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whooaaa -- shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri catches him with one hand, gripping his bicep. He watches the spear cartwheel down to splash in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him upright. Shouts at him in English and Na'vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should not be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN ANGLE FROM FAR ABOVE -- several WOODSPRITES float do through the trees. FOLLOW THEM as they descend silently toward Jake and Neytiri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI, sensing a presence, looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOODSPRITES, PULSING with purpose, float right toward Jake. They dance gently around his shoulders and head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off her amazed look) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More woodsprites gather around him.   Several ALIGHT on h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake holds still, knowing he should be afraid -- but some he's not. He spreads his arms. More sprites come, landing all over his arms, hands, body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
