dialogues.text: CU NEYTIRI -- reacting with a mixture of wonder and dread

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atokirina'. Seeds of the Great Tree -- very pure spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake -- now a pulsing, glowing, fluttering MASS OF LIGHT moves one hand slowly, not wanting to break the spell. He studies one of the sprites dancing on his palm until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- WHOOSSHH! the woodsprites whirl up and away, scatterin into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri seems shaken.   She seizes his hand and pulls him after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH JAKE as he gazes about him in growing wonde He touches leaves as he passes, watching the bioluminesce shiver through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks down as -- they cross a bed of purple MOSS whi reacts to the pressure of their footsteps. Rings of green light, like ripples on a pond, expand outward from each footfall. Exploding rings of light where his feet touch down. Dream-like, surreal beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON THEM as they run over a large root, across a mirr like POOL at the base of a WATERFALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake follows Neytiri, running along a raised root-trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE hears WHOOSH-WHOOSH and snaps a look as a BOLO flies him, spinning end for end and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHWHAP!! -- tangles around his legs.   He topples off the and crashes into the foliage below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE untangles himself, getting up to run just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL NA'VI RIDERS thunder toward him. They are riding DIREHORSES -- six-legged, armor-skinned alien Clydesdales

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that the riders' QUEUES are connected to the horse long moth-like antennae -- a neural-link with which they command the horse, leaving hands free for weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The riders aim bows and spears at Jake as they approach. turns to bolt, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NA'VI HUNTERS melt out of the shadows, weapons aimed -- blocking his retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri drops to the ground next to Jake and confronts th LEAD RIDER. She shouts sharply in Na'vi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Tsu'tey, what are you doing?! He is my captive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY(tsu-Tay)is young and powerfully built, with sculp features and a proud jawline, piercing eyes. Tsu'tey swin off his mount with fluid grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) These demons are forbidden here. I will kill this one as a lesson to the others!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey draws his bow but Neytiri leaps between him and J confronting him warrior to warrior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Stop! There has been a sign. This is a matter for the Tsahik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey clenches his jaw with frustration -- frustration her as much as the situation. He turns and angrily remoun his direhorse, barking a command to the HUNTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Bring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grab Jake and haul him to his feet. Encircled by spe and bows, he is shoved forward along the trail, as Tsu'te and the others ride ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE is hauled roughly toward Neytiri's village, which is sheltered inside one of the GREAT TREES. HOMETREE is 250 meters tall, with a trunk four times the diameter of the largest Sequoia, and a base of massive mangrove-pillars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY rides inside the columns at the base of Hometree, shouting an ululating WARNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is force-marched through the pillars into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open CENTRAL AREA. The villagers gather to see the arriving hunt party. We see the people of the tribe -- mothers with babies, old women, young hunters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gawk at the alien, expressions ranging from curiosit outright hostility. The huge eyes of the children follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is amazed at the size of HOMETREE inside. By the lig of the COOK-FIRES he can see up into a vast cylindrical gallery -- a living cathedral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear membranes -- sturmbeest bladders -- filled with fluttering bio-luminescent insects, act as area lighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The central space is dominated by the SKULL of some enorm creature, mounted with much embellishment on a TOTEM. Standing in front of this, awaiting their approach, is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYTUKAN (AY-too-kahn), the Clan Leader. Eytukan has deepl chiselled features and a long chest mantle of THANATOR CL His normally stern features are clouded further by anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Why do you bring this creature here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri addresses Eytukan in Na'vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) I was going to kill him, but there was a sign from Eywa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glowers at her as he responds, pointing at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) I have said no dreamwalker will come here, to offend our home! His alien smell fills my nose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri stands her ground, answering in a respectful but submissive tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Father, many atokirina came to this alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father is deciding whether to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father!? (to Eytukan) Uh, good to meet you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake steps forward, offering his hand, and the hunters JU to restrain him, shouting. But they all FREEZE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commanding FEMALE VOICE echoes through the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NA'VI) Step back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MO'AT (MOH-aht) stands on the second level, looking down. She is a severe woman in her 50's. Her bearing is haughty her expression friendly as a hanging-judge. Her outfit is elaborate, denoting her rank as CLAN MATRIARCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) I will look at this alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an expectant hush as Mo'at descends the helical of Hometree, a kind of natural spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is Mother. She is Tsahik -- the one who interprets the will of Eywa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Eywa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri kneels before her like an acolyte as Mo'at passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villagers stare silently as the Matriarch circles slo around Jake, examining his tail and the end of his queue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thick accent) What are you called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake Sully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She produces a long THORN between her fingertips. With a flourish she strikes his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake flinches. RED BLOOD wells up and Mo'at rubs some between her fingertips. She tastes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have tried to teach other Sky People. It is hard to fill a cup which is already full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cup is empty, trust me. Just ask Doctor Augustine. I'm no scientist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I was a Marine -- uh, a warrior. Of the Jarhead clan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) A warrior! I could kill him easily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) No! This is the first warrior dreamwalker we have seen. We need to learn more about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?   What are they saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neytiri, subtitled) Daughter. You will teach him our way, to speak and walk as we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI looks shocked, then angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Why me? That's not fair!     I only--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) It is decided!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri subsides, turning to glare at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake) My daughter will teach you our ways. Learn well, Jakesully. We will see if your insanity can be cured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Neytiri, her expression stern --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) He is your responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri nods, accepting, but she's not a happy camper. grabs Jake's arm and pulls him roughly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's all good, right?   You and me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER, Neytiri leads Jake up the spiral to the SECOND LEV He now wears only a ratty LOINCLOTH. His wounds are bound with plant-fiber bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ENTIRE CLAN is squatting at dinner in a huge circle. stop talking and turn to gaze at Jake as he enters the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri crosses the circle to the cook pit and returns wi several large leaves heaped with food. She kneels next to Jake, placing the food in front of him almost DEFIANTLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never told me your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri te Ckaha Mo'at'ite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, again, a whole lot slower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exaggerated slowness) Neytiri. Nay-TEE-ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake knows she's baiting him.   He smiles in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nay-TEE-ree. That's nice. Nay-TEE-ree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE CIRCLE, Tsu'tey, Mo'at and Eytukan sit togethe glancing up occasionally from their food to the stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) These aliens try to look like people, but they can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) He seems dim to me.   And his eyes are too small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI motions for Jake to take portions from the servin leaves onto his own leaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom likes me.    I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MO'AT, watching Jake and Neytiri, leans over to Eytukan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Neytiri will test this "warrior." Hey may learn nothing -- but we will learn much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak truth. We must understand these Sky People if we are to drive them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake munches on a white shrimp-like thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These rock. What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teylu. You call beetle larvae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake blanches. She heaps some more onto his leaf -- a CHALLENGE -- and Jake meets her eyes, takes a handful, an starts munching enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's some damn fine teylu. That's like grandma's teylu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU TSU'TEY, warily eyeing Jake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) I say she will kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping level -- families nesting in groups on woven hammocks the size of trampolines. The hunters sleep along SPOKES joining the inner trunk to the tree's outer shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake lies awake in a hammock, people rustling in the dark around him. Neytiri is nearby, curled up like a little gi She stares at him for a moment, then closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake watches the glowing bugs fluttering inside a night- light, a pulse of life energy. A strange peace spreads through him. He closes his eyes and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE is over JAKE in the Link, SLAPPING him, as Max and hover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on back, kid, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha --? Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, blinking.   Reality crashing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you were dug in like a tick. (she helps him sit up) Is the avatar safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huge grin) Yeah, Doc -- and you are not going to believe where I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREAKFAST the next day. The other drivers lean forward, hanging on Grace's re-telling of the tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so the kid's out there one night and he's got the Queen Bitch herself offering him the spare room and the car keys. Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something you can teach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the other scientists clap Jake on the shoulders i congratulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awesome, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM chomps his bacon, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake, getting serious) For reasons I cannot fathom, the Omaticaya have chosen you. God help us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE has reported to SELFRIDGE and QUARITCH. Quaritch tur from gazing out at the wall of forest, displaying a feral grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarhead clan? (he laughs) And that worked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GRINNING) Yeah. They want to study me.   See if I can learn to be one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you seize the initiative. I wish I had ten more like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Sully -- find out what these blue monkeys want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELFRIDGE (cont'd) We try to give them medicine and education. Roads! But no -- they like mud. I wouldn't care except --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge turns to a large 3D GRAPHIC DISPLAY, pointing. road runs from Hell's Gate to a proposed new mine miles a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their damn village is sitting right over the richest unobtanium deposit for a hundred klicks in any direction. Which sucks -- for them -- because they need to relocate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking that in) Does Augustine know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she does, and she's on the next ship back if she tries to cock-block me on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- who talks them into moving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TURNING) Guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they won't go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ICY) I'm betting they will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing the indigenous looks bad, but there's one thing shareholders hate more than bad press -- and that's a bad quarterly statement. Find me a carrot to get them to move, or it's going to have to be all stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is shaken by the enormity of this new responsibility

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got three months.    That's when the dozers get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE pumps his chair across the lab, flanked by GRACE and NORM. Grace holds STEREO STILL PICTURES in front of him, at a time -- images of clan members she has shot over the years -- a kind of flash card drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey. (next photo) Mo'at. (next photo) Eytukan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the clan leader -- (indicating Mo'at) -- but she's the spiritual leader.   Like a shaman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dialogue is continuous as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. So who's this Eywa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Eywa? Oh, only their deity. The Great Mother. The goddess made up of all living things. You'd know that if you had any training whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hauls himself from wheelchair to Link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got a date with the chief's daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off. Jesus, it's like kindergarten around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake settles into the soft embrace of the link, Grace inputs commands at the control station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri was my best student. She and her sister Silwanin. Just amazing girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't meet the sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (QUIETLY) No, she's dead. (turning to him) Okay, let's go -- village life starts early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Link is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace lowers the bio-sensor array over Jake's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything unusually stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the clamshell and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE'S AVATAR, blinking awake, staring up at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMETREE, like a gothic cathedral overhead.   Sunlight st down through gaps in the towering vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE walks among the villagers, who go about their daily tasks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- young girls sit together, weaving and SINGING.    They up as he passes, then go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --two men clean the fish they've caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a young mother pounds seeds into meal, while nursing a infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --children chase each other and climb like monkeys. One b LITTLE GIRL runs up to Jake, stops -- staring -- then shr with laughter as she runs back to her playmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRINNING, Jake turns to see NEYTIRI cantering toward him DIREHORSE. She leads a second horse, an old sway-backed MARE. His grin drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE nervously grips the surcingle of the mare. Neytiri h its nose-ring while Jake clumsily mounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake bends one of its ANTENNAE down to the tip of his que He hesitantly touches them together and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT -- the tendrils INTERWEAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's PUPILS DILATE and his mouth drops open. The horse' eyes also go wide and it HONKS nervously. Neytiri touches fingertips to the neural interface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is shahaylu -- the bond. Feel her heartbeat, her breath. Feel her strong legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake closes his eyes, nodding.   One with the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY and another young hunter come out of the forest leading TWO DIREHORSES. The magnificent animals drink fro the edge of the pool. Tsu'tey watches Jake's riding lesso with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may tell her what to do -- (she touches her head) -- inside. For now, say where to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse LAUNCHES into a GALLOP. Jake flops around, with idea how to sit the animal, and is promptly THROWN OFF. H lands painfully in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, brushing mud off knees and ass, as Neytiri le the horse back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF JUMP CUTS -- Jake falls off the horse in variou ways, seemingly landing harder each time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, face down in the mud of the riverbank. He painfu rises to hands and knees. Which is when he sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY and another HUNTER thundering across the shallow river on their direhorses. Spray blasts up from their hooves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands, covered in mud, as Tsu'tey stops his horse n to him, looking down with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neytiri) I knew this guy could speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey turns to Neytiri, who is leading the old mare bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) This alien will learn nothing.   A rock Sees more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs in agreement. Tsu'tey and the other hunter whee their horses around and THUNDER OFF into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI gestures to Jake's horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grouped around a table are JAKE, COLONEL QUARITCH, SELFRI and few ENGINEERS and OFFICERS. Jake is talking them thro plans he's made of Hometree's inner structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got outer columns, then a secondary ring here, and an inner ring. Then a core structure, it's like a spiral, that's how they move up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need accurate scans of all these columns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON MAX, at the stairwell. He's been watching Jake talking rapidly to Quaritch, but can't hear him. Frowning he backs away, down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, GRACE and NORM are packing science gear and supplie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not about to let Quaritch and Selfridge micro-manage this thing. (she looks pointedly at Jake) We're going up into the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) There's a mobile link up at Site 26 that we can work out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hallelujah Mountains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesssss! (off Jake's look) The legendary Floating Mountains of Pandora? Heard of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SAMSON THUNDERS over the rainforest, climbing into the shrouded mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the SEALED COCKPIT, Norm is up front, sitting left sea Trudy can talk him through the flight controls. Jake and Grace are behind them, in the jump-seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Norm's UNCONSCIOUS AVATARS ride in the open bac compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only takes tiny inputs.   Here, put your hand on the cyclic --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the stick between her knees. Norm hesitantl reaches over and rests his hand on hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel how small the moves are? You barely have to think it, and the aircraft reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORM -- reacting to tiny inputs from the hot lady-pilo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAMSON is dwarfed by enormous ARCHES OF ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these magnetic formations.   We're getting close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we are. Look at my instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dash, many of the displays are fritzing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. We're in the flux vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHEAD, a cloud bank parts, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HALLELUJAH MOUNTAINS.   Right in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. My. God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake leans forward between the seatbacks for a good look the front canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S POV -- enormous islands of rock are hovering a hal mile above the ground. They are overgrown with rainforest and straggly beards of vines hang down beneath them. Waterfalls stream down the sides and dissolve into spray the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, staring in amazement.   It is both awe-inspiring disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy turns, grinning at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE AERIAL -- the Samson is tiny as it approaches the floating islands of rock. An archipelago among the clouds they cast great shadows over the forested slopes below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what does hold them up? Grace explained it to me -- some kind of maglev effect because unobtanium is a superconductor, or something. At least somebody understands it. Just not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A remote RESEARCH STATION -- TWO SHACKS and a few cluster instruments perched on a promontory near the Hallelujah Mountains. The shacks are AIRLIFT MODULES the size of bus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAMSON LANDS, beating the grass with its rotor-wash. humans hop out, wearing MASKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward the Shack, taking in the spectacular panorama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM and TRUDY assist JAKE with his chair as they cycle i through the AIRLOCK. GRACE is already inside, starting th GENNY. She turns on the lights and equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are 4 bunks, a clutter of science gear, and -- thro a short connecting corridor -- THREE LINK UNITS in the se module.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grace powers up the Link equipment, Jake stops to look STEREO STILL PICTURES which are taped and tacked up aroun her workstation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PICTURES -- Grace posing at the school with vari grinning children. There is one of her with two lanky gir a younger Neytiri and an older girl who looks much like h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, take number two, it's the least glitchy. Norm, I need you to operate Jake's link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm glares at Jake as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You got a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm turns to Grace, his frustration boiling over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trained three years for this mission. I speak the language fluently. (he points at Jake) He falls off the frickin' turnip truck and all of a sudden he's cultural ambassador!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not our choice, Norm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glowers at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I didn't come out here to wash the dishes while you're on some interspecies booty call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't go far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to Jake's link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN the central shaft of Hometree, 80 meters to ground. Villagers are ant-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake tries to keep up with Neytiri as she leaps up the co trunk like a lemur. He climbs the last section, arriving of breath beside her. She leads him OUTSIDE, onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large branch. Through gaps in the foliage Jake can see other Great Trees scattered across the landscape, like enormous umbrellas above the rainforest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI strides out across the branch toward some kind of STRUCTURE -- a WEB made of thick woven fiber. DARK SHAPES clinging to it stir with a leathery RUSTLING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri makes a series of TRILLS and CLICKS. One of the shapes MOVES toward them, emerging into a shaft of sunlig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge MOUNTAIN BANSHEE. Much larger than the forest banshees, this thing is taller than a Na'vi with a 10 met wingspan. A leathery FWHOOP, like the crack of sails, as alights on the branch right in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri feeds it a large scrap of meat, which it SNATCHES gulps down. She murmurs to it and strokes its NECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lets out a signature SHRIEK, and some of the others in shadows nearby answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri flip-catches her queue and gently connects it to Banshee's ANTENNA. It shivers and stretches its wings as neural connection is made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ikran is not horse. Once shahaylu is made, ikran will fly with only one Hunter in the whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs smoothly onto the animal's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To become taronyu -- Hunter -- you must choose your own ikran. And he must choose you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANSHEE shivers with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeyaaahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ducks as the great wings EXPLODE OPEN and the banshe DROPS off the branch. It swoops down across the forest canopy, banks hard, lets out a CRY and beats its wings in power climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completing the bank, Neytiri directs the banshee into a c SWOOPING FLYBY, and Jake instinctively ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NEYTIRI -- flying in perfect fusion with her winged mo the rainforest rolling beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEREO VIDEO-LOG IMAGE -- Jake has just switched on the camera. He looks tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do this?   I need some rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE, behind him, looks up from her MICROSCOPE, scowling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- now, when it's fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. (to camera) The days are starting to blur together. The language is a bitch, but I figure it's like field-stripping a weapon. Repetition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE AND NEYTIRI kneel together inside Hometree. Neytiri touches her lips with her fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seyri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches her nose, her ears, her eyes in quick sequenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ontu, mikyun, nari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI stands next to him, correcting his position as he draws a longbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARKING commands, she SMACKS him on the shoulder, then th elbow, repositioning him roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri thinks I'm some kind of retard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMAN JAKE emerges from the LINK to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY and NORM caught IN THE ACT on Norm's bunk. Norm blu and Trudy waves, pulling the blanket over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm's attitude has improved lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM works with JAKE at the small table in the SHACK kitc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ireiyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm comically exaggerates the pronunciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irrrreiyo. Irrrreiyo.   You've gotta roll the R, r-r-r-oll it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm makes Jake repeat the word, getting more frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good he's back on board, but he thinks I'm a retard too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH JAKE'S FEET as he runs over rocks, leaping a thick root, running on across the rough bark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feet are getting tougher.   I can run farther every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri leads him along a massive root, and soon they are running 30 meters above the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sprints with her through the trees, trying to keep up. She CLIMBS and LEAPS with the ease of a spider monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to trust my body to know what to do. With Neytiri it's learn fast or die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri LEAPS off into space, falling, falling until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches an enormous palm leaf and, gripping it, allow its DROOP to slow her fall. She lets go, plummeting, and catches another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE FOLLOWS in a leap of faith. THE CAMERA PLUNGES with him, from leaf to leaf, down and down in a dizzying kinet rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops down from the last leaf, landing next to her on game trail. He is exhilarated to still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri is surprised -- that he followed.   That he lived

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON HUMAN JAKE, in the shack. Thinking as he looks a the pictures of Grace with the laughing kids at the schoo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE COMMONS -- AVATAR NORM formally greets MO'AT. The Matriarch looks on as GRACE kneels to hug children she kn Grace's eyes sparkle as she chats with them in Na'vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sweet-talked Mo'at into giving Norm and Grace a hall pass. Now Grace even makes me coffee before link every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace looks up to see Neytiri approaching. It is an awkwa moment between them. Grace makes the formal gesture of greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Na'vi, subtitled) I See you, Neytiri Mo'at'ite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I See you, Doctor Grace Augustine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY -- NEYTIRI kneels on a game trail, pointing o the tracks in the mud to Jake. She touches the edges of t plants around her, and sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm learning to read the trails, the tracks at the water-hole, the tiniest scents and sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE AND NEYTIRI watch through a screen of leaves as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HERD of huge, armored STURMBEEST walks through the shal of a lake. In the middle of the herd, the babies are sheltered from predators among their parents' legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the BULLS trumpets, and a flock of TETRAPTERONS ta flight, an explosion of purple wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stares at the strange and wild alien tableau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER PLACE -- NEYTIRI STANDS utterly still, except for ears, which move with a life of their own. Her eyes are closed. She speaks very softly to Jake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you hear nothing, you will hear everything. When you see nothing, you will See everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I have no idea what she's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Neytiri creep quietly, stalking a large male HEXAPEDE -- a six legged deer-like creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake expertly nocks an arrow and draws his bow as Neytiri watches. He takes a bead on the hexapede -- tracks it for beat with the drawn bow, then RELAXES his arm. Zen archer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a month and I'm still not allowed to make a kill. She says the forest hasn't given permission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI and JAKE crawl through the undergrowth.   She poi and he parts some leaves to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER VIPERWOLF bringing meat to her cubs, which frisk around her legs. She licks their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot of crap like that. She's always going on about the flow of energy-- the spirits of the animals and what not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDEO-LOG IMAGE -- HUMAN JAKE talks into the lens.    He' changing -- un-shaven, cheeks hollow. Pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING) I just hope this treehugger shit isn't on the final.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible behind him, Grace is hunched over her samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up) This isn't just about eye-hand coordination out there. You need to listen to what she says. Try to see the forest through their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- this is my video-log here, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI AND JAKE move through the NIGHT FOREST, surrounde galaxies of shimmering bioluminescence. They move gracefully, soundlessly -- two forest spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE -- the pupils of his cat eyes dilated. The night forest floods his brain with its million bio-sources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT SHOT, from overhead -- Jake and Neytiri bow-fishing from a dugout canoe over huge glowing ANEMONES at the bot of a pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large fish swims silhouetted against the pastel glow. Jake drills it. He holds up the fish, triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY -- Neytiri stands close behind Jake, adjustin his position as he draws his bow. Only now her hands are GENTLE as they move on his arms, his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aware of her touch, Jake's focus is broken.   Their eyes and she pulls away quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT -- they enter a CLEARING filled with chest-high fer Neytiri signals him to move slowly. They approach a creat on one of the ferns. An ugly, stick-like LIZARD-THING perched on a frond. As he approaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP! A long spine whips in a circle, unfurling a bioluminescent membrane -- a disk a meter across, opening like a Chinese fan. It FLIES OFF, a living Frisbee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FAN LIZARD FLOATS across the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri plunges among the ferns with a SHARP CRY. An EXPLOSION OF COLOR as dozens of FAN LIZARDS take flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning widely, she hops around like a little girl, unti they are all flying. And for the first time, she is unguarded and joyful, totally herself with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE LINK -- Jake's eyes open in the darkness. He doesn't know where he is. He weakly pushes open the lid, blinking at the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is backwards now. Like out there is the true world, and in here is the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON AVATAR JAKE silently drawing his bow, his eyes focused in intense concentration. A beat -- the arrow fli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE PULLS the arrow from the twitching body of a hexaped He dispatches it with his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks haltingly, but with feeling, in Na'vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NA'VI) I See you Brother, and thank you. Your spirit goes with Eywa, your body stays behind to become part of the People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI watches with approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clean kill. You are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying in the link, Jake looks exhausted, pale, thin.   No helps Grace get him to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still losing weight.   Here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a microwaved burrito. He looks at the now a food. Bites into it without enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a kill today. We ate it.   I know where that meal came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other body. You need to take care of this body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I'm serious -- you look like crap. You're burning too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes the cigarette out of her mouth and stubs it ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of this shit, then you can lecture me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, as your boss and someone who might even consider being a friend someday, to take some down time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. Tomorrow we leave for Iknimaya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE walks past Jake, starts making herself coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- you're gonna go ride a banshee. Or die trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Grace. This is what I've been working for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is your check up from the neck up, Marine. You're getting in way too deep. (she turns away) Trust me, I learned the hard way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scans the pictures tacked up around Grace's workstat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did happen at the school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE looks up from making coffee.   Her eyes track acros pictures of the laughing children.   Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri's sister -- Sylwanin -- stopped coming to school. She was angry about the clear-cutting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE sips her coffee, grimaces at the taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One day, she and a couple of other young hunters came running in, all painted up -- they'd set a bulldozer on fire -- I guess they thought I could protect them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE'S voice stays oddly CALM as he tells this terrible story, while getting MILK out of the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troopers pursued them to the schoolhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO as she pours the milk -- her hand is SHAKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed Sylwanin in the doorway. Right in front of Neytiri. Then shot the others. (MILDLY) I got most of the kids out, before they shot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake realizes that Grace is on the verge of tears and desperately trying to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scientist stays objective -- we can not be ruled by emotion. But I poured ten years of my life into that school. They called me sa'atenuk. Mother. (turning to him) That kind of pain reaches back through the link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE sits down at the table, looks intently at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a job. Learn what you can -- but don't get attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE looks at him with real PAIN in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not our world, Jake.   And we can't stop what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY leads three direhorse riders up the trail -- two TEENAGE HUNTERS and JAKE, who's riding well enough to kee up. The horses' hooves CLOP right next to a sheer drop in misty canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iknimaya translates roughly as stairway to heaven. It's the test every young hunter has to pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY signals a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP-SLOPE AHEAD is an astounding formation. Thick vine-lik trees have trapped large FLOATING BOULDERS of UNOBTANIUM their gnarled grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred meters above them more boulders are WOVEN into twisted vine-trunks. This is some sort of freak natural occurrence -- like the mythical beanstalk, going up into clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a THUNDERING ROAR, like an artillery barrage, an the ground SHAKES. Jake looks around at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the FLOATING MOUNTAINS grinding against the flank nearby mesa. A huge rockfall is set loose. The mountain i drifting toward them, filling half the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hunters dismount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE looks up at the beanstalk going into the clouds. He turns to Tsu'tey, who is checking the young hunters' gear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We doin' this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake leaps to catch up as Tsu'tey and the hunters swarm u the base of the beanstalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 METERS up the BEANSTALK, the hunters nimbly climb alo the vine-trunks. They clamber over one of the unobtanium BOULDERS which is lifting this incredible tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE looks down -- the massive trunk dwindles to the size a licorice stick. A chunk breaks off a boulder as he clim over it -- it floats upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the upper branches of the beanstalk. Above the the craggy underbelly of MONS Veritatis looms. Spray from one of the waterfalls hits them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the HANGING VINES are brushing over the upper branches of the beanstalk with a crackling hiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one the hunters grab onto vines as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake shrugs and leaps to a passing vine, his feet danglin over nothingness. They climb toward the floating islands above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINY FIGURES cross a causeway of vines connecting a small island of unobtanium to the main mass of Mons Veritatis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT looking down a rock face bigger than Half Dome the sheer side of Mons Veritatis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banshees circle next to the cliffs, flashing in shafts of sunlight. Waterfalls dissolve into nothingness below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waterfall THUNDERS down into the void like a faucet of gods. Jake looks down the sheer cliff at the world far be -- a view from Olympus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHRIEK and the THWAP THWAP of leathery wings -- NEYTIRI BANSHEE swoops in to perch at the edge of the grotto. She dismounts and, like a falconer, covers its eyes with a wo HOOD. It waits, docile, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She joins Jake and the hunter party. Tsu'tey leads them through the cave until they emerge onto a CLIFF FACE. And Jake sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANSHEE ROOKERY. HUNDREDS of banshees huddle on rock croppings as far as the eye can see. They cling to the wa with the fore-claws on their wings, or perch on ledges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jakesully will go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey smirks at Jake, a challenge in his eyes. The two teenage Hunters are scared but trying to act tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey scowls when Neytiri leads Jake out onto the ledge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERING) Now you choose your ikran. This you must feel -- inside. If he also chooses you, move quick, like I showed. You will have one chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I know if he chooses me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will try to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of sight of Tsu'tey, Neytiri takes his hand and squee it. Jake feels a rush of emotion, but she breaks away lik it didn't happen. He is on his own, on the ledge with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BANSHEES. They eye him as he approaches. Several SHRI and take flight. Others flap their wings and yawn, showin rows of fangs, in a threat display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake unrolls a weighted leather strap, like a one-ended B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE MALE spreads enormous wings, SHRIEKS, and glares straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks directly into its eyes -- and strides toward i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The challenged banshee HISSES and leaps at him, jaws wide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake times the lunge, swinging the bolo, feinting and the slipping aside as the banshee's jaws miss him, SNAPPING S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake WHAPS the bolo across its snout. The weighted thong whips twice around its long jaws, tying them shut. A MUFF SCREAM and it SLASHES at his stomach with razor talons bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is already leaping, over the talons and tackling the banshee around the neck. It topples on its side, and he SWARMS IT -- arms around its thrashing head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs its whip-like antenna and brings it toward his queue but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bony head SLAMS sideways, and BAM! -- clocks him righ the face, almost knocking him out and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT WRITHES, flinging him to the ground. He slides on the rock and almost goes over the edge as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI gasps. Tsu'tey laughs and yells mockingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bolo is coming loose as the creature shakes its head, pissed off now, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake scrambles up and leaps straight at it. Claws rake hi leg but he gets his arms around its head and CLAMPS DOWN HARD. They flop to the ground and he scrambles on top, pinning it and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabs its whipping antenna, locks it under his arm, and j the end of his queue into it. They FUSE together and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banshee stops struggling. It lies there panting.   Th are locked together, literally eye to eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! You're mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU BANSHEE -- the pupil like a deep black well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake relaxes his grip and slowly, warily, slides his leg the creature's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri runs to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First flight seals the bond. You cannot wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake sits astride the creature, feeling its power.   He g a hank of the beast's main, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeeyyyaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWAP! THWAP! The banshee is off like a shot. Jake SCREAM as they PLUMMET off the cliff -- the banshee WAILS and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall together, spiralling out of control, and he is almost tossed lose. The thing is SQUAWKING and SHRIEKING much he can't think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the hell up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level out!     Fly straight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It levels out. Jake cocks his head, only thinking "bank l and the animal complies. He settles the banshee into an e loping beat of its huge wings, while he catches his breat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI'S BANSHEE falls into formation with him.   She si "follow me" and DIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake guides his banshee clumsily after her. Neytiri's banshee moves with precise movements of its wingtips, whi Jake's wobbles and dips, almost falling out of the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA SWOOPS after them as Neytiri leads an arcing D around the flank of Mons Veritatis. The scenery is stunni They pass waterfalls and swoop between hanging vines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri leads Jake in a sharp bank, skimming close to the cliffs. They punch through streamers of cloud and emerge into sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is getting the hang of it. He jinks left, then right then dives, tucking himself tight against the animal's ba He's reckless, fearless. Half in control and LOVING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri dives next to him as he lets out a long WHOOP of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI squats with Jake, using her hands to explain flig principles like one fighter pilot to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN a sheer cliff. SWOOOSH! Jake and Neytiri div their mounts STRAIGHT DOWN PAST CAMERA, pulling out and soaring into a series of aerobatic turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not be much of a horse guy.   But I was born to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY FLY in close formation with TSU'TEY and the young HUNTERS, 5 banshees flashing through scarves of mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY. Jake dives, playing hide and seek with Neyti among the clouds. They are wild and free in a wild world. She grins and banks hard, diving -- catch me if you can. DIVES after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE GROTTO, by firelight, JAKE'S BANSHEE snaps at a pi of meat which he playfully pulls back. He's teaching it t take the food more slowly. He strokes its long head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY is nearby with the young hunters.   He eyes Jake frustrated hostility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DAY -- Jake and Neytiri fly abreast, soaring easi She points and Jake sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIZARRE GEOLOGICAL FORMATION. Arches of magnetic rock f rainbows of stone above a deep CALDERA. In the center of caldera is a single, enormous WILLOW TREE, gnarled and ancient. This, we will be told, is THE WELL OF SOULS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE flies with Neytiri along a forested ridge. She is teaching him to hunt from his banshee. They carry their b at the ready, scanning below them for prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE SHADOW covers him and Neytiri SHOUTS a warning. looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LEONOPTERYX in a delta-dive, whistling straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a banshee, only several times larger, it is the king predator of the air: the GREAT LEONOPTERYX.   Striped scarlet, yellow and black, with a midnight blue crested h -- it is both gorgeous and terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunter has become the prey. JAKE snap-rolls and dives toward the forest canopy. He plummets into the gloom as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-CRASH -- the leonopteryx tears through foliage, followi him down, both diving like missiles and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE yanks into a hair-pin bank, right through a gap betw two huge branches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcing the leonopteryx to brake with a loud FWOOSH of wi It banks away with a frustrated SHRIEK. Two flaps of its mighty wings and it is gone, back above the canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE LEONOPTERYX, as its fanged mouth opens in a bloodcurdling SCREECH which echoes among the mountains. T lord of its domain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, shaken. Neytiri flies up, her expression the Na' equivalent of Oh my God. A beat -- they both crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ponders images Grace has called up at her workstatio science graphics of the Leonopteryx. Trudy and Norm are crowded around as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Great Leonopteryx is the apex aerial predator. Not only rare, but the sightings tend not to get reported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy makes a clicking motion with her thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There usually isn't time to key the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The People call it Toruk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (TRANSLATING) Last Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one you ever see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw one take out a gunship once -- WHAM! Total frickin' yard sale. Ate the crew like peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- Grace is scanning through images and Jake sto her on one -- a 3D aerial shot of the strange arched formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitraya Ramunong -- The Well of Souls. It's their most sacred place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves the virtual camera, and we seem to fly around t Well of Souls, catching only a glimpse of the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something big is going on in there, biologically. I'd die to get samples, but outsiders are strictly forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- Jake looks through the pressure window at HUM GRACE and NORM outside. Wearing masks, they are taking readings from some time-series experiments Grace has set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TRUDY watches, JAKE works fast to download Grace's ima of the Well of Souls onto a memory chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls the chip, then hesitates. Torn by what he is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't give him something, he's gonna shut us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the chip and she slips it into a pocket of h flight-suit just as Grace and Norm enter from the airlock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE STARES up at the TOTEM SKULL, which we now recognize that of a GREAT LEONOPTERYX. NEYTIRI watches as he reache up to touch the tall indigo crest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather's grandfather was Toruk Macto -- Rider of Last Shadow. Toruk chose him. It has only happened five times since the time of the First Songs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri takes his hand, because that's what the Na'vi do they're telling you something important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toruk Macto was mighty -- he brought the clans together in a time of great sorrow. All Na'vi people know this story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN SLOWLY on the skull totem, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, NEYTIRI and other FLYING HUNTERS swoop low above a OF STURMBEEST -- a rapids of thundering muscle. Dust rise from this living river like steam from a python's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH the herd. A HUNTER appears in FG, astride a direhorse at full gallop. The sight is breathtaking. He hurls a 3 meter spear and one of the sturmbeest CRASHES d flipping twice from momentum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE ROLLS IN like a fighter jet, his banshee screaming. draws and fires his bow. The arrow strikes true, in the plexus between the armored shoulders and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST crashes to the ground. Skids to a stop in a clo of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI swoops in next to Jake, arms raised and grinning wolfishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU TSU'TEY, banking around Jake's kill.   Jake looks up, Tsu'tey SALUTES in grudging admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The central space is lit by a BONFIRE, around which the H FESTIVAL is in full swing. Wild dancing. People gnawing o massive sturmbeest ribs. A bowl of some kava-like intoxic is passed around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI dances in a flowing costume as the BANSHEE SPIRIT NORM is dancing seductively with his own tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, surrounded by young hunters, acts out the leonopter attack with his hands. The leaping fire-light plays acros the eye sockets of the TORUK SKULL, bringing it to life. seems to watch Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY squats next to Jake, the usual scowl on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake braces himself -- and Tsu'tey holds up the KAVA BOWL offering it to him. A challenge or an olive branch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes a long, hearty drink as some of the young hunt hoot and clap hands in a fast rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch that stuff.   It'll knock you into next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake offers the bowl back to Tsu'tey.   They lock eyes. Tsu'tey drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER -- AN EMPTY BOWL drops, landing on a pile of empty bowls near the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER ON JAKE and TSU'TEY, sitting amid the rowdy hunters Tsu'tey looks a little blearily at Jake. Finally, he GRIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought -- enough drink -- you would not be so ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey looks deep into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your warriors -- hide inside machines -- fight from far away. (he looks at Jake) I did not think a sky person could be brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Jake can answer, NEYTIRI'S lithe shape runs throug the circle of silhouetted dancers toward them. She takes Jake by the hand and pulls him up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must dance! It is the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY watches as she leads him away, his face darkening the moment of connection to Jake lost to anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunters WHOOP and CHEER as Jake joins the circle of dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes Grace's hand and pulls her up, protesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE lets the DRUMS and CHANTING flow through him. He let himself go, dancing from the inside, channeling the prima energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE is rocking out, grinning. We see the young girl, so repressed, who lives within her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake and Neytiri flow amongst the dancers, but they are looking only at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of the young girls watching from outside the cir are giggling and talking about them. Mo'at and EYTUKAN follow their look, seeing the obvious connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) We cannot let this seed grow. Her path is with Tsu'tey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, dancing with abandon to the primal beat, eyes lo with Neytiri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE VISTA -- mist blowing through the treetops as the morning sun burns it away. A spectacular panorama of a va primeval land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE TRACKING among the trees, the sunlight shafting like light in a cathedral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to put in words the deep connection the People have to the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH IN THE BRANCHES of a tree, Jake watches as Neytiri gently bends a large pitcher-like flower toward her, sipp nectar which is sweet and thick as honey. An incredibly sensuous image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see a network of energy that flows through all living things. They know that all energy is only borrowed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO SHOT of a purple flower, beaded with raindrops.   A hand picks the flower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and one day you have to give it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN into a hole dug among tree roots. The body o an old Omaticaya WOMAN lies curled there like an unborn b in the womb of the earth. The purple flower is gently pla on her body, joining flowers, totems and beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at recites a prayer as Neytiri, acting as acolyte, pla a WOODSPRITE, a seed of the Great Tree, on the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth is poured over the LENS and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE WAKING UP in the Link. DARK as a coffin. He pushes t lid off, letting in light, and lies there. He looks pale haggard, with a scraggly beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe it's only been three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SITS in front of the video log camera, late at night is many log entries later. He has lost a lot of weight. H looks like a junkie watching a test pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the lens) I can barely remember my old life. I'm not sure who I am anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a sky of thunderheads, the forest is a dark wall be the fence. SELFRIDGE, wearing an exopack, TEES UP while G and JAKE approach from the direction of the Ops Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good of you to stop by. How's it going out there? Our blue friends all packed up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge swings his DRIVER with good form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I keep hooking it.   It's the damn pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BALL drops into the mud just past a marker which read 220. A TROOPER walks over to retrieve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low gravity and the high air density cancel out so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called us back to report -- you want to hear it or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is making incredible progress, years worth in just a few months. But -- we need more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not what I was hoping to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It starts to rain. Selfridge calmly pulls an umbrella fro his golf bag and snaps it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, it's their ancestral home. They've lived there since before human history began. You can spare them a few more weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is inevitable. What does it matter when it happens? I'm sorry, Dr. Augustine. You're out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves them standing there to get drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A break table, under a harsh overhead light. Quaritch pul up a chair, turns it around, and sits astride it facing J He studies Jake's pale, sunken face. The scraggly beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gettin' lost in the woods, are you son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake can't meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your last report was two weeks ago. I'm starting to doubt your resolve. From what I see, it's time to terminate this mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake eyes flare with alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you've given me plenty of usable intel. Like this "Well of Souls" place -- I've got them by the balls with that, when it turns into a shit-fight. Which it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake feels hollow inside, knowing what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll get your legs back, like I promised. (puts his hand on Jake's SHOULDER) It's time to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ponders this. Isn't this what he was doing all this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta finish this thing. There's one more test -- the Dream Hunt. It's the final stage of becoming a man. Then I'm one of them. They'll trust what I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard for him to even form these words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I can negotiate the terms of their relocation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you need to get it done, Corporal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange horizontal LIGHTNING branches through the floatin mountains, twisted by the magnetic fields. The sky is bla and heavy with clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is gulping black coffee like a tequila shot, looking pretty STRUNG OUT. GRACE is smoking furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I can't allow this.   You're just not strong enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last door -- I'm going through it. You can help me or get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pushes past her toward the corridor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing him) Will you listen to me? Sometimes the Na'vi themselves die in these vision quests. The venom takes you to the edge of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) And the psychoactive alkaloid in the worm- - we have no idea what that'll do in an avatar brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake breaks free and wheels away, down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE follows JAKE as he crosses to the Link. A sheet of LIGHTNING flashes across the sky outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm is initializing the Link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calibrating. Thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hands on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what you prove out there-- you are still in here. (shaking him) Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go all the way -- become one of THEM--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FURIOUSLY) Goddammit, Jake, you can never be one of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm looks up, startled at the VEHEMENCE in GRACE' voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our life out there takes millions of dollars of machinery to sustain. You visit -- and you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this, Jake pulls himself from his wheelchair, leve himself into the Link, hauling his useless legs inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SOFTENING) You can never truly be with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stops, pinioned by the truth.   He seems suddenly ve lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why I'm here? Because Quaritch sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- to embed with the Omaticaya. To find out how to screw them out of their home. By deceit or by force, he didn't care. And if it turned out to be force, then how best to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm is in shock.   But Grace is eerily calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about now, Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that guy any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace nods.   She's been on his journey every step of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I tell Quaritch the truth, he yanks me out -- I never see her again. And if I tell her the truth, the clan throws me out -- that's if they don't cut my heart out and show it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks hopelessly at the two of them.   In his own pe Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't understand what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't even have a word for "lie" -- they had to learn it from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sees he is on the verge of tears.   Lost and alone, between worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I taught it to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLEADING) Grace. I've gotta go.   They're waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Link is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stops him as he tries to close the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake. You can't carry this burden much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling wanly) It's okay. Mo'at says an alien mind probably can't survive the Dream Hunt anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace closes the lid. It feels like closing a coffin. She watches his psionic patterns aligning to his avatar, somewhere out in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norm) Prep my link. I'm going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SITS, eyes closed, as Neytiri and another young hunt paint his face and body in preparation for uniltaron -- t Dream Hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When your Spirit Animal comes, you will know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet with emotion neither can conceal any long

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT. GRACE stands with the crowd at the ramp to HOMETREE'S LOWEST LEVEL. Jake barely sees her as he goes the spiral. She tries to follow, but is barred by a hunte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELOW, seemingly in the womb of the earth, Jake walks slo into the center of a tight circle of seated elders and hunters. An ELDER is slowly rapping a large WATER DRUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- MO'AT purifies him with smoke from burning he CHANTING in a low monotone. Jake, squatting, washes the smoke over himself with his palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO - MO'AT'S FINGERS unwrap a piece of wood riddled wi holes. She catches the end of a glowing purple WORM, and draws it out of the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Oh wise worm, eater of the Sacred Tree -- bless this worthy Hunter with a true vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MO'AT places the worm on Jake's out-stretched TONGUE. It twists on itself, lighting his mouth before he closes it. indicates he should chew. He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO -- AN EARTHEN JAR is opened. EYTUKAN removes a writhing black ARACHNOID, the Pandoran equivalent of a scorpion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places it against the back of Jake's neck and presses. insect drives its stinger into Jake's skin and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grimaces. Mo'at and Eytukan step back, leaving Jake alone in the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri watches intently, joining in the low chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW DOLLY IN on Jake. His eyes OPEN. He looks around at faces -- they seem to TRANSFORM, becoming threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks down at the palms of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE'S POV -- his hands recede, his whole body, the groun and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSTANTLY the circle of Na'vi recedes, as if to a distant horizon, leaving vast ground in between. SPACE is utterly distorted, and SOUND as well -- echoing, THUNDEROUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECU JAKE -- pupils DILATED black. He looks around and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onlookers are gone, replaced by a ring of glowing tre which seem miles high. The whole image is bathed in spect radiance. Jake looks down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
