dialogues.text: JAKE'S POV -- his body and hands transforming -- fingers stretching into tendrils, legs becoming roots which sprea outward across the ground, a thousand glowing dendrites w connect to the roots of the trees and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO REALITY -- Jake is on his hands and knees, PUKING the dirt. He contorts, crying out in agony as the venom contracts his muscles but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN HIS VISION Jake stands serene on a FLOATING MOUNTAIN CLIFF. A GREAT BLACK SHADOW covers him, the unmistakable silhouette of a diving LEONOPTERYX. The LAST SHADOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SCREAMS down on him as the shadow grows larger -- RUSH into his face, into the blackness of his pupil which FILLS THE UNIVERSE and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAL JAKE writhes in the dirt, his back arched as his mus seize. He foams and thrashes, his eyes rolled back in his head, while inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME ITSELF HAS ACCELERATED -- clouds scream around the mountain tops, mist boils through the forest. He feels th wind of time blowing through him as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAL JAKE claws the ground, moaning, staring blindly whil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE, IN POV he FLIES over the landscape of Pandora --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but the forest is BLASTED. Fires flicker among trees th are BURNED black and lifeless in a smoky twilight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great WINGED SHADOW is cast below, rippling over the devastated ground. AVATAR JAKE looks down at the shadow. Realizes HE is casting it, and we RUSH IN to his PUPIL an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK from the eye of a GREAT LEONOPTERYX, flying lor and terrible over the land. It lets out an almighty SHRIE which seems to echo to eternity and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM CUT to Jake, on his back, GASPING -- back in his bod He weakly rolls up to one elbow and looks around the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri's face is flooded with relief.   The faces of the elders look at Jake expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Did your Spirit Animal come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks from Eytukan to Mo'at, Tsu'tey and the elders. can he tell them what he has seen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at puts her splayed fingers against his face, seeming peer into his troubled soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake) Something has come. (to the others, subtitled) It will take time for the meaning to be clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back, and Eytukan motions for Jake to stand. He gets up, weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE ENCLOSURE -- Eytukan emerges with Jake and th others. The entire clan is gathered, waiting to hear what has happened. Jake looks up at the Leonopteryx Skull Tote which seems to stare down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE watches, her eyes brimming. Proud. Relieved. Amazed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eytukan places both hands on Jake's chest and holds them there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) You are now a son of the Omaticaya.   You are part of the People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the members of the clan press forward, crowding aroun and putting their hands on Jake's shoulders, back, chest hands upon hands, until he is connected to everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and NEYTIRI run silhouetted in the night. Behind the waterfalls cascade down in the silvery light. POLYPHEMUS RISES behind the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI DIVES from a rock, slicing into a mirror of water Jake follows her and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER, they swim over glowing ANEMONES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seem to float in a cosmic dance above a luminous gar of waving shapes. Tiny purple fish swirl around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their hands come together, fingers twining, as they float weightlessly, as if between worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing, they run together into a stand of WILLOWS. Thei trunks are as gnarled as bonsai. Long faintly glowing tendrils hang straight down in pastel curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underfoot, a bed of moss glows faintly. It REACTS to thei footsteps with expanding rings of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an exquisitely beautiful spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The willows stir, responding to their presence. She holds her hands, letting the TENDRILS caress her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a place for prayers to be heard. And sometimes answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake puts out his hands and the tendrils play over his fingers, his palms, his forearms. His eyes go wide. We he the WHISPERING of ancient Na'vi VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like -- a sound you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call this utraya mokri -- the Tree of Voices. The voices of our ancestors, who live within Eywa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few WOODSPRITES circle around them, some alighting on t shoulders and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand, very close together now. Her eyes are intense almost luminous. He feels drawn into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she pulls back a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Omaticaya now. You may make your own bow from the wood of Hometree. (she looks away) And you may choose a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Amazon warrior trying so hard to sound casual.   Jake suppresses a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have many fine women. Ninat is the best singer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Ninat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is Beyral -- she is a good hunter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake puts his fingers on her lips to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already chosen. But this woman must also choose me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hands and their fingers intertwine, moving gently over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She already has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his face close to hers. She rubs her cheek agains his. He kisses her on the mouth. They explore each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she pulls back, eyes sparkling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kissing is very good. But we have something better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him down until they are kneeling, facing each o on the faintly glowing moss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri takes the end of her queue and raises it. Jake do the same, with trembling anticipation. The tendrils at th ends move with a life of their own, straining to be joine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO SHOT -- The tendrils INTERTWINE with gentle undulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE rocks with the direct contact between his nervous sy and hers. The ultimate intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come together into a kiss and sink down on the bed o moss, and ripples of light spread out around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WILLOWS sway, without wind, and the night is alive wi pulsing energy as we DISSOLVE TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. She is collapsed across his chest.     Spent.   He strokes her face tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri, you know my real body is far away, sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises up, placing her fingertips to his chest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This body is real. (she touches his forehead) This spirit is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are luminous, honest, infinitely deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was first your teacher, I hated all Sky People. But you have also taught me. (WHISPERING) Spirit is all that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays her head down, against his chest, listening to h heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am with you now, Jake. We are mated for life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is our way. (INNOCENTLY) Oh. I forgot to tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rouses up, making her look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. I'm there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lays his head down, and her arms enfold him, shelterin him as he sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's eyes open in the darkness. He just lies there, thinking. In his coffin. In another world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWN BREAKS in the sacred glade. Shafts of orange morning light. Jake and Neytiri asleep in each others' arms. Maxf Parrish painting. But then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROAR OF ENGINES. Neytiri awakens with a start. The SPLINTERING, CRACKLING of forest being crushed under enor treads gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHE WATCHES in growing horror as the BLADE of a bulldozer becomes a dark wall behind the sheltering ring of willows She shakes Jake, shouting at him in Na'vi to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake! Wake up! Where ever you are, come back to me now. Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMAN JAKE is in a hurry to get back to the link. GRACE, still groggy, chases him with coffee and microwaved eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here -- eat this. I'd hate to have to force-feed a cripple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the lid shut before he can enter and sticks the plate under his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GRINNING) She's not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sighs heavily and starts wolfing the eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri SCREAMS as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The willows begin to fall before the blade, to be ground under the treads. AVATAR JAKE is directly in the path. Sh tries to lift him, but he is too heavy. She is screaming him, frantically trying to wake him, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake adjusts himself in the link chair. He hands Grace th empty plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when was the last time you took a shower? Jesus, Marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pushes her hands away and pulls the lid down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVATAR JAKE wakes up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI dragging him, screaming.   He leaps up as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOZER pushes inexorably into the glade, splintering t trees, plowing the earth before it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE RUNS into the path of the bulldozer, waving his arms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Heeeey! Stop! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He positions himself where the camera-eyes of the robotic juggernaut will see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MONITOR -- Jake shouts but there's no sound feed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER as the TRACTOR OPERATOR sees him and pulls back on remote throttles. He yells to his SUPERVISOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got one of the natives blockin' my blade here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This attracts the attention of Selfridge, who comes over the workstation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN -- Jake, in his Omaticaya loincloth and ceremonial body paint, is unrecognizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Selfridge) What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll on. He'll move. These people have to learn that we don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THROTTLES as the operator pushes them forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN Jake stumbles back, tripping, disappears be the blade for a second -- reappears, running to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE grabs a rock and LEAPS onto the dozer.   He climbs quickly to the CAMERA MAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! The rock crashes into the lens of the camera. Jake beats the rock furiously against it, pounding it to junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MONITOR -- as Jake's demonic face is replaced by noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls back on the throttles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JUGGERNAUT grinds to a stop. But the ROAR of engines continues because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE DOZERS and TRACTORS advance nearby, crushing the for before them. Trees are slashed down by the PLASMA CUTTERS Terrified animals flee before the onslaught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POWERSUITS and TROOPERS stride through the ravaged forest blasting anything that moves. A trooper sees Jake on the dozer. He rips off a BURST and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounds CLANG into metal as Jake dives off the machine. He grabs Neytiri and they run into concealing foliage. From behind a screen of leaves, they watch as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOZERS advance, obliterating the sacred site, leaving only mud and wood splinters in their path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU NEYTIRI, stunned by the nightmarish, unfathomable wrongness of it. She sobs as the willows die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINUTES LATER, the operator is playing back the CAMERA'S for Quaritch and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze it, right -- there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MONITOR -- the image expands, until Jake's face is cle frozen in an animal snarl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON QUARITCH as his jaw clenches in cold fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and strides toward the door, shouting to his WAT COMMANDER as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a pilot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RAIDING PARTY of hunters, their bodies painted, raise weapons overhead. AVATAR GRACE watches with growing alarm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Tsu'tey will lead the war party!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey steps forward, face full of hate, raising a war c among the hunters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Please -- this will only make it worse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not speak here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and NEYTIRI cross the commons toward them. Jake feel all eyes turn toward him. He takes her arm, stopping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Neytiri, low) Okay, listen. There's something I have to tell you. It's gonna be hard. I just need you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees TSU'TEY striding toward them, his face a mask of fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey walks right up and SLAMS Jake in the chest with b hands. It is so unexpected, that Jake topples on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mated with this woman?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands. He reaches out for Neytiri.   She goes to hi clutching his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) We are mated before Eywa. It is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey turns to Mo'at and Eytukan, his face anguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Neytiri was promised to me! Everything is changing. Everything is being destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey points at Jake, his pain shifting to rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) These aliens kill everything they touch, like poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri! If you choose this path, you can never be Tsahik. Your life will be wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri looks at her mother -- sees the grief in her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey draws his knife and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeeeeeaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUNGES AT JAKE, who's ready this time -- he sidesteps, blocking the knife, and elbows Tsu'tey HARD in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey reels back, nose bleeding. He starts forward on a second attack but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eytukan grabs his arm and spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Stop! This is not a proper challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey glares at Jake while sheathing his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I challenge you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I accept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARITCH rides left seat as Trudy pilots through the mountains. She glances at him, then toggles the aircom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loveshack this is Samson One Six inbound hot to your pos. I have Colonel Quaritch with me and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Quaritch SLAMS the switch, cutting her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I tell you to announce us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry sir, it's procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norm punches buttons on the comms console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson One Six?   Trudy? (no answer) Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks helplessly at Jake and Grace's link units -- no to warn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY AND JAKE square off. Each holds a long, solid sta The entire clan crowds around them in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way to get him to goddamn listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY LEAPS at Jake with a sharp cry and Jake parries w his staff. The staves CLACK off each other as the two combatants LEAP, DUCK and STRIKE furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey sweeps Jake off his feet with a roundhouse hit to ankles, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake ROLLS out of it and catches Tsu'tey in the belly wit the blunt end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY'S SAMSON lands. QUARITCH and a posse of troopers ju down and rush the Shack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY wades in with a series of short, sharp blows. Jak swings with equal fury. Both fighting from the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staves whistle through the air, and CLACK together li gunshots. Jake presses hard, and Tsu'tey staggers back, stumbling as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake lands a SOLID HIT, dropping him to his knees, just a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE INNER DOOR bangs open and QUARITCH stomps toward Grac Link controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hang on, you can't interrupt a link in progress, it's dangerous -- wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch shoves him aside and SMACKS his fist down on the POWER switch. Grace's unit goes dead and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVATAR GRACE'S eyes roll back and she keels over.       N barely catches her before she hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE parries as Tsu'tey swings but then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's eyes go blank just as -- K-RACK! Tsu'tey puts one alongside his head. Jake sprawls, completely inert. Tsu't pokes him with his staff, then raises it and lets out a piercing VICTORY CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SLAMS OPEN the Link, amped from the fight, furious -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your goddamn mind?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crossed a line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch PUNCHES HIM HARD. Jake flops back, dazed. The troopers yank him out and ZIP-TIE his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY draws his KNIFE, and bends down, grabbing Jake by hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) This is a demon in a false body. It should not live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his knife to Jake's throat but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI BLIND-SIDES him at full tilt. Tsu'tey sprawls, ro comes up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri crouched like a lioness over Jake, her KNIFE and teeth bared, her ears flattened. She SNARLS with primal fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey stands panting. He pushes through the crowd and w away, calling for his hunters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON MONITOR -- showing JAKE'S AVATAR FACE on the doz camera, as he pounds a rock into the lens. The shot FREEZ on Jake's ANIMAL SNARL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER -- HUMAN JAKE sits, bruised and bleeding, watching himself on the monitor. GRACE and NORM stand nearby, rubb their wrists where the zip-ties bit in. SELFRIDGE and QUARITCH watch with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me down, son. You got a little local pussy and completely forgot what team you play for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake meets his gaze with a defiant glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, listen, there may still be time to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fucking hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is momentarily stunned by Quaritch's fury. But she meets it with her own intensity, not backing down an inch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what, Ranger Rick? You gonna shoot me? (to Selfridge) You need to muzzle your dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just take this down a couple notches, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Quaritch) You say you want to keep your people alive. Start by listening to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake nods to Grace to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Selfridge) This is bad, Parker. Those trees were sacred to the Omaticaya in a way you can't imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? You throw a stick in the air around here it falls on some sacred fern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about pagan voodoo here -- I'm talking about something real and measurable in the biology of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FRUSTRATED) Which is what exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace's nerve fails. A rush of conflicting emotions -- th need to act, to do something, colliding with her scientif rigor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake) I can't do this. How am I supposed to reduce years of work to a sound bite for the illiterate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him what you know in your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Parker, steeling herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, look -- I don't have the answers yet, I'm just now starting to even frame the questions. What we think we know -- is that there's some kind of electrochemical communication between the roots of the trees. Like the synapses between neurons. Each tree has ten to the fourth connections to the trees around it, and there are ten to the twelfth trees on Pandora --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot I'm guessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more connections than the human brain. You get it? It's a network -- a global network. And the Na'vi can access it -- they can upload and download data -- memories -- at sites like the one you destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have you people been smoking out there? They're just. Goddamn. Trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to wake up, Parker. The wealth of this world isn't in the ground -- it's all around us. The Na'vi know that, and they're fighting to defend it. If you want to share this world with them, you need to understand them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We understand them just fine.   Thanks to Jake here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake shares a look of alarm with Grace as Quaritch select NEW CLIP on the main monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON MONITOR -- VIDEO-LOG IMAGE of Jake, looking hagg and borderline deranged, rambling in a late-night monolog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to give up their home -- they're not gonna make a deal. For what? Lite beer and shopping channel? There's nothing we have that they want. We're a horror to them. We're the monsters from space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE watches with a growing dread as his words condemn th people he has grown to love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're never going to leave Hometree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch FREEZES the recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since a deal can't be made -- it gets real simple. (to Jake, icily) So thanks. I'm getting all emotional.    I might just give you a big wet kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, we have to talk, like rational people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd cherish that, but unfortunately you're out of here on the next shuttle. All of you. I'm shutting down the Avatar Program, effective now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JAKE, GRACE AND NORM, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALL OF FIRE. Silhouettes of direhorse riders cross in MOTION, spears and bows held high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONITOR SCREEN IMAGE -- WAINFLEET pans a camera across th smoldering hulks of BURNED DOZERS. The toppled remains of charred ampsuit. Dead troopers bristling with arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit with banshees first. Set the ampsuit on fire. Driver's toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch and Selfridge look on grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the squad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six bodies -- that's all of `em. And the equipment is totalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge is stares soberly as Quaritch outlines the plan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it with minimal casualties to the indigenous. We'll clear them out with gas first. It'll be humane. More or less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge sighs and rubs his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't go limp on me now. This is exactly the incident we needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX and the lab staff are glumly packing files and equipm under the watchful eye of armed SEC-OPS TROOPERS. JAKE, GRACE, NORM stare bleakly at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bulldozed a sacred site on purpose, to trigger a response. They're fabricating this war to get what they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. That's how it's done. When people are sitting on shit you want, you make them your enemy. Then you're justified in taking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY RUNS into the lab, breathless. She's wearing full flight gear and carrying her helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sec-ops is rolling the gunships.   They're gonna hit Hometree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.    We're spooling up now! I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pumps furiously toward the door, Grace following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELFRIDGE surveys the airfield, where crews swarm over th gunships, loading ordnance. He turns as JAKE and GRACE charge toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, wait. Stop! These are people you're about to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fly-bitten savages who live in a tree! Look around -- I don't know about you but I see a lot of trees. They can move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, there are children in there. Babies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Selfridge, you don't want this kind of blood on your hands. Let me try to talk them out. They trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SELFRIDGE, considering this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELFRIDGE and an escort of armed TROOPERS accompany Jake Grace to the links. The two enter their units, as NORM an MAX prep the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got one hour. Unless you want your girlfriend in there when the axe comes down, you get them to evacuate. One hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake lowers the upper clamshell. Norm starts the sequence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire clan is gathered, with Eytukan and Mo'at presiding. Jake looks around, feeling the gaze of the Peo upon him. He steels himself, and speaks in clear Na'vi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Eytukan, I have something to say, to everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Speak, Jakesully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) A great evil is upon us. The Sky People are coming to destroy Hometree. They will be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur of fear and anger goes through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) You have to leave, or you will die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sent me here to learn your ways. So one day I could bring this message, and you would believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Jake? You knew this would happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is unable to meet her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (ANGUISHED) At first it was just orders. Then everything changed. I fell in love-- with the forest, with the Omaticaya People -- (he looks at her) -- with you. And by then, how could I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri can barely breathe. She is shaking with the enorm of it, her voice cracking with rage and pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you, Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri. Please, I only wanted to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will never be one of the People! NEVER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY yells to his HUNTERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Bind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grab Jake, who doesn't resist. Others seize Grace. Both are driven to their knees, and their arms bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCORPION GUNSHIPS darken the sky as they come over the to of the trees. At the head of the formation is one much larger ship, a monster 150 feet long -- the GENERAL DYNAM C-21 DRAGON GUNSHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch, next to the pilot of the Dragon, surveys the wo below like Napoleon astride his horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and GRACE are lashed to posts at the front entrance Hometree. The People look up as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRAGON and its escort of GUNSHIPS arrive over the tre The DOWN-BLAST from their rotors creates a maelstrom of flying leaves and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE DRAGON COCKPIT Quaritch watches a targeting screen a telescopic image of Jake and Grace tied to posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd say diplomacy has failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY and another HUNTER hold knives to the throats of two avatars, glaring defiantly at the gunships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they mean to cut their throats if we don't back off. Make sure you get a nice close-up of that. I can tack it onto the after-action report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE YELLS to Neytiri, Tsu'tey, the others gathered nearb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to get out of Hometree! Run to the forest! Please, I'm begging you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYTUKAN scowls at Jake, then GRABS TSU'TEY and yells --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Take the ikran! Attack from above!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey grabs some hunters and runs up the roots of Homet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE COCKPIT Quaritch grows impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's get this done. Give me forty millimeter gas rounds, right in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.   CS forties. Going hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Dragon's stub-wings the 40mm ROCKET LAUNCHERS open with a BARRAGE of leaping fire which FLASHES down and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-WHOOM!K-WHOOM!K-WHOOM! -- the inside of Hometree ERUPTS with multiple EXPLOSIONS of TEARGAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GAS rolls across the confused villagers. They begin t cough and gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eytukan and the remaining HUNTERS bravely fire at the gunships with their longbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE DRAGON'S COCKPIT, Quaritch laughs as arrows CLINK against the armored windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMID CLOUDS of teargas, the Omaticaya run, stumble, colla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling/subtitled) Everybody outside! Go to the Forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villagers pour out of Hometree. Everyone is yelling. Piercing SCREAMS in the boiling gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, eyes streaming, struggles with his bindings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-WHOOM! An INCENDIARY ROUND explodes inside the Commons FLAMES ROAR through the base of Hometree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE HOMETREE it is a burning smoky HELL. Flames roar u the inside like a chimney. STRAGGLERS scramble outside, coughing and dragging wounded with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High up in the trunk, TSU'TEY and his hunters leap rapidl from spoke to spoke, climbing barely ahead of the firebal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE the fire is driven by the rotor-wash toward JAKE GRACE who are still bound tightly to the posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the smoke, MO'AT appears in front of Jake.    She a KNIFE and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLASHES DOWNWARD. Jake looks down, surprised, to see his bonds falling away. He meets her eyes, which are filled w horror, but also something else. Call it faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are one of us.   Help us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes the knife and cuts Grace free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta move!    He's gonna blow the columns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Grace realizes what he means, he grabs her and they RU Around them the Omaticaya flee in horror and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE COCKPIT, Quaritch watches as the Omaticaya stream from the Great Tree, running along roots and branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you scatter the roaches. Okay, switch missiles. Give me H-E's at the base of the west columns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, switching missiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN TRUDY'S SAMSON -- she hears the other pilots acknowled Quaritch's order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her finger OFF the fire-control and pulls her aircraft out of formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING IN ON QUARITCH, the Hometree reflecting in his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISSILES stream down from the DRAGON and the other gunshi and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The base of Hometree VANISHES in a chain of HIGH-EXPLOSIV BLASTS. The massive PILLARS fragment into matchsticks, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Omaticaya watch in horror as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMETREE GROANS and starts to MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a cacophony of cracking, splintering roots, the mighty tree TOPPLES with agonizing slowness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BANSHEE EYRIE, TSU'TEY and the other hunters spur their mounts into flight. They swoop among the branches a the tree, the one fixed thing in their lives, MOVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It CRASHES DOWN through the forest canopy, crushing the lesser trees in its path, FALLING PONDEROUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOMETREE hits the ground like the end of the world, raisi great cloud of dust and pulverized debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE DRAGON cockpit, Quaritch surveys the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work people. Alright, let's light it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCENDIARIES launch from the gunships, EXPLODING into gou of FIRE in the debris of Hometree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUNSHIPS fan the flames through the trees like a fire storm. The Omaticaya retreat as a WALL OF FIRE advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SEARCHES for Neytiri amid swirling smoke and sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri!   Neytiri!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE is gathering crying CHILDREN, and herding them away from the fire-storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI stumbles through the burning wreckage at the edge the INFERNO. She sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYTUKAN. A large shard of wood is driven through him like spear. He recognizes her as she kneels over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Daughter -- take my bow. Protect the People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his last living moment he places his bow in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She collapses over him, her face crumpling in grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE reels out of the smoke.    Kneels next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves him away and stands, screaming at him as tears stream down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me, Jake. Go away! Never come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stumbles back as she slumps down by her father's bod Sparks and smoke swirl around him. He watches as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NETYIRI kneels, grieving. Slumped over, clutching her stomach. Keening like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION -- Jake staggers lost and alone through the burning forest. Utterly shattered. Eyes vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a warrior who dreamed he could bring peace. Sooner or later though, you always have to wake up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELFRIDGE watches a video feed of the destruction on one the monitors. Max and NORM stare in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TROOPER crosses to the console and grabs the handle of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strings are cut. Jake flops to the ground, limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere in the smoky Hell, Grace slumps unconscious. Th crying kids pull at her. Mo'at, leading a group of Omaticaya, comes upon the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the kids and pulls them away, leaving Grace's avatar helpless in the path of the flames. She hesitates, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Bring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKNESS. Then the top clamshell of Jake's unit is yanke upward, and troopers grab him, zip-tie his wrists as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A HILLSIDE -- a grieving Neytiri stands with Mo'at and Omaticaya refugees. Two hunters pull Grace's avatar on a travois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as the flames burn like a funeral pyre below. great pall of smoke darkens the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Grace, and Norm are in a common holding cell. They sit, staring in silence. Too wired to sleep, too emotiona drained to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never wanted us to succeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE DESK OUTSIDE, the lone TROOPER looks up as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUDY approaches along the corridor, pushing a stainless steel trolley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally I think steak's too good for these traitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get steak?    That's bullshit. Let me see that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard bends to look into the hot cart and   --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUZZLE of Trudy's pistol presses behind his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops. (shoving him down) All the way down, pendejo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She WHISTLES and MAX trots around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy binds the guard with one of his own zip-ties as Max grabs his KEY CARD and runs to the cell. Swipes the card. The door is rolling open when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER TROOPER rounds the corner. Trudy takes him down w a sharp BLOW to the windpipe and a THAI KNEE to the ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile the first TROOPER is getting up, but Max CLOCKS heartily with a coffee urn. He goes down and stays down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was unexpectedly satisfying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy plants a kiss on Norm as he runs out of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, you rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake wheels out, grabbing the sidearm from the fallen tro as Trudy binds his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Max and Trudy) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake faces his motley group, chambering a round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you say?    Time for a revolution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy grins and taps his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the utility corridor under the base, Jake pumps the ch furiously, as the others jog. They reach an AIRLOCK and s donning EXOPACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Trudy) Get your ship fired up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy nods. She grabs Norm and enters the airlock.     Ja turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. I need somebody on the inside I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods.   Jake grips his hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE SAMSON, Norm is helping Trudy race through the preflight checks as the turbines spool up. A LIGHT hits them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armored TROOPER approaches, aiming his AR at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to shut down and step out of the vehicle! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE rolls up behind him, aiming his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it nice and easy, troop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trooper turns, sees the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground, face down. Hands behind your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trooper hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what he goddamn says!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. Norm jumps down and grabs the trooper's rifle an side-arm, covering him, while Grace helps Jake from chair the back bay of the chopper. She throws his chair in, and jumps in herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARITCH, watching a monitor, sees what's happening down the airfield. He slams his palm down on an ALARM BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws his PISTOL.   Strides toward the EMERGENCY DOOR. undogs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLDING HIS BREATH Quaritch yanks the hatch open and stri onto the outer landing. Inside people scramble for MASKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAMSON lifts off in a blast of rotor-wash just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARITCH OPENS FIRE and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROUNDS rake the ship. Trudy banks hard, using the bottom shield them. Bullets WHACK into the ship as she climbs-ou over the tree-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's fist pumps the air exultantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahh, crap. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Grace and freezes. She is looking down a BLOODY HAND. She clutches her abdomen, covering the spreading stain. Looks at Jake, wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna ruin my whole day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM'S AVATAR, with an AR slung over his shoulder, stands the roof of the LINK MODULE. He gives a thumbs up signal. The lift cable goes taut and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shack LIFTS OFF THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy's Samson beats the grass of the mountain meadow, straining to lift the module on a long-line sling. The sh sways as Trudy banks across forested slopes and heads dee into the HALLELUJAH MOUNTAINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the windows, clouds and cliffs pass by, lit by Polyphemus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is yanking stuff out of the Samson's trauma bag, whi Grace lies curled across two back seats, hugging her bloo soaked abdomen. She is pale and shocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trudy is flying on visual only, by the light of Polyphemu Her instruments are showing gibberish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least they won't be able to track us up here. Not this deep in the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strongest at the Well of Souls, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, `cause that's where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Grace an ampule of morphine for the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you some help, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, it doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   The People can help you. I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn light paints the massive ARCHES of magnetic rock abo the Well of Souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny as an insect, the SAMSON passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Well of Souls. The heart of the forest. I knew the People would go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WELL OF SOULS is a deep caldera 100 meters across. It ringed with enormous WILLOWS whose roots seem to pour dow the sheer rock walls like candle wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BOTTOM, in a natural amphitheater, the Omaticaya refugees are clustered around a central rock outcropping which forms a kind of dais and altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shafts of dawn light reach to the bottom of the grotto, lighting a single willow -- the MOTHER TREE. Ancient and gnarled, it grows in the center of the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its ROOTS spread down to the grotto floor, where they mer with the roots of the willows ringing the Well -- forming braided mat resembling the surface of a brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at stands on the dais, leading them in a CHANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Wise ancestors who live within Eywa, guide us. Give us a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shack descends from the sky like a gift from the gods It bumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace lies, comatose, in her open link. Trudy gives Jake look that says "not much time." Jake feels Grace's cold forehead, then crosses to his own link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Trudy helps him in, Norm rapidly preps the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LOW) Tsu'tey is Olo'eyctan now. He's not going to let you get near that place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta try, Norm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls the clamshell down and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE'S AVATAR -- HIS EYES OPEN. He sits up. The forest silent, shrouded in smoke that the sun can't penetrate. T animals have fled. Ash blows on the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outcast. Betrayer. Alien. To ever face them again, I was gonna have to change the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE -- JAKE reaches the top of a rise. The forest beyond is utterly DEVASTATED. The trees burned and fallen Small fires still flicker across a landscape in Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE stares. It is his vision, made real. He stumbles through the dark wasteland, sparks and ash swirling aroun him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREECH.    Jake looks up as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS BANSHEE -- bonded for life -- flaps down to a landing front of him. He steps to it, and strokes its head. It nudges his chest like a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes your whole life boils down to one insane move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, boy. Time to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GREAT LEONOPTERYX glides effortlessly along the ridge where Jake and Neytiri first encountered him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It scans for prey below, its magnificent indigo-crested h cocking left, then right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I had it figured, Toruk is the baddest cat in the sky. Nothing attacks him. So why would he ever look up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE -- THE SMALL SHADOW of Jake's banshee falls ac the back of the mighty Toruk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was just a theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE DIVES and WE RUSH DOWN toward the great beast and ou own shadow then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Omaticaya people lift their voices in a SONG filled w tragic loss and yearning for deliverance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NEYTIRI, singing. A SHADOW CROSSES HER FACE.   S looks up, and her eyes go wide as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TERRIBLE CRY echoes, turning all eyes skyward.   AN ENO SHADOW covers the crowd as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TORUK comes out of the sun, beating its huge wings to slo its descent. Its crimson and black wings, backlit by the sun, seem to glow from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The People CRY OUT in alarm and scatter as the dreaded be alights in their midst. And that's when they see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, riding high on its shoulders, plugged-in to its antenna. It folds its wings and stands calmly amid the paralyzed Na'vi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toruk lowers its body. They stare in awe as Jake dismount and strokes the magnificent animal's flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI, TSU'TEY and MO'AT watch in stunned amazement as legendary Rider of Last Shadow walks toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing the words) Toruk Macto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri raises her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHOUTING) Toruk Macto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE FACES of the Omaticaya -- new hope dawning in thei eyes. WHISPERS flow among them, the words REPEATED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toruk Macto... Toruk Macto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks through the crowd, straight to Neytiri at the of the dais. He looks into her enormous eyes, and the emotion between them is powerful and pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hoarse whisper) I See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri's eyes brim with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid Jake -- for my people. I'm not any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes Neytiri's hand and climbs the steps of the dai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MO'AT steps back in awe as he approaches. He turns to Tsu'tey, who stares at him with fear and incomprehension. Jake plays to the rapt crowd as he says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SUBTITLED) Tsu'tey of the Rongloa, son of Ateyo. I stand before you, ready to serve the People. (then just for Tsu'tey) You are Olo'eyctan, and you are the best warrior. I can't do this without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey struggles with his emotions. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will fly with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ireiyo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE turns to the MATRIARCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is dying.     I beg the help of the Great Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her, Jakesully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- AVATAR JAKE carries Grace's HUMAN BODY, light in his arms like a child. Jake walks through the crowd to the dais, followed by NORM, who carries GRACE'S AVATAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look where we are, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes flutter open. She looks up wonderingly at the Mo Tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a wan smile) I need to take some samples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at directs them to lay both bodies among the roots on altar-rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at touches Jake's shoulder and he steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (QUIETLY) The Great Mother may choose to save all that she is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'at's hand indicates Grace's AVATAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in this body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU JAKE, realizing the enormity of what she's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possible, yes. She must pass through the Eye of Eywa -- and return. But Jakesully-- she is very weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake kneels next to Grace, taking her tiny human hand in avatar hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, they're gonna fix you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is barely conscious.    She grips his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- always held back. But you gave them your heart. I'm proud of you, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake feels his throat close with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace's eyes blaze with intensity though her voice is fai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help them.     You do whatever it takes. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- MO'AT stands in a kind of trance amongst the tendrils of the Mother Tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI and the other acolytes dance hypnotically. All th Omaticaya sway and chant to the rhythm of the drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACRO SHOT -- fine, hairlike THREADS have emerged from th roots and are gently spreading over Grace's HUMAN skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, still holding her hand, watches her body being fuse the root-floor by a thousand connections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE'S AVATAR is gently connected by the same questing R CILIA-- they entwine with the QUEUE and spread over the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grotto is dark except for the spectral GLOW of the willows. The CHANT continues, hypnotically. MO'AT, on her knees beneath the Mother Tree, writhes her arms in the tr state. Her eyes are rolled back, showing only WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE GASPS and her eyes SNAP OPEN. Her expression is AMA as if seeing something so beautiful it can never be explained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HER HAND -- GRIPPING Jake's convulsively, as she tries anchor herself to this world for a few more seconds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with her Jake -- (an amazed whisper) -- she's real --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace SHUDDERS, as pain shoots through her. BLOOD seeps through the silken white root-cilia growing across her abdomen. Drowning WHITE in shocking CRIMSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exhales a last shuddering breath -- and goes STILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the roots falling away from her human body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE TURNS hopefully toward her AVATAR -- but the roots a falling away from it as well. It sleeps -- VACANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MO'AT stops the chant. She crosses to Jake and kneels wit him, touching his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her wounds were too great, there was not enough time. She is with Eywa now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI removes Grace's mask and gently closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake stands slowly, barely holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEYTIRI comes to him and he sees the despair and hope conflicting on her face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he raises his head.   TURNS to face TSU'TEY and th CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your permission, I will Speak now. You would honor me by translating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsu'tey gestures assent, and they face the clan together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE SPEAKS, the pain of Grace's death in the passion and fury of his voice. Tsu'tey TRANSLATES beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sky People have sent a message that they can take whatever they want, and no one can stop them. But we will send them a message. Ride out, as fast as the wind can carry you, tell the other clans to come. Tell them Toruk Macto calls to them. Fly now with me brothers and sisters! Fly! And we will show the Sky People that this is our land!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TSU'TEY finishes with a bloodcurdling war-cry, and the en CLAN responds, their shouts echoing across the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE takes Neytiri's hand and runs to the leonopteryx. vaults onto its back and pulls her up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HUNTERS run to their banshees, mounting quickly. Jake leonopteryx rises on mighty wings into the night sky. Wit thunder of wings, the banshees take off after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS -- POLYPHEMUS. Across its face, the banshees ri like a swarm of bats. Groups of riders peel off in differ directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE and NEYTIRI stand before the gathered members of ANO CLAN. Jake speaks as she translates. We don't hear the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK ACROSS the faces of the clan, a sea of eyes in flickering fire-light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We rode out to the four winds. To the horse clans of the plain, to the ikran people of the mountains. When Toruk Macto called them, they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS ANGLES -- SLOW MOTION as riders vault onto their armored direhorses. Banshee riders raise spears and bows, spurring their mounts to leap skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a WHOOSH and the crack of mighty wings, JAKE RETURNS Jake and Neytiri alight from his legendary mount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around them HUNDREDS OF BANSHEES are landing.   A gatheri eagles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE we can see hundreds of Na'vi streaming down in the Well of Souls and many hundreds more camped in the fo above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIREHORSE RIDERS are arriving along many trails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANSHEE RIDERS circle and swoop, darkening the sky above grotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE, standing next to the Leonopteryx, watches his army gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's standing room only as all base personnel are crowded into the dining hall. A portable 3D GRAPHICS PROJECTOR ha been set up, and the lights are down. QUARITCH stands in front of the display image -- a classic pre-mission brief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, you are fighting for survival. There's an aboriginal horde out there massing for an attack. First slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display shows an overhead image of the Well of Souls. looks like Woodstock in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These orbital images show the hostiles' numbers have gone from a couple of hundred to over two thousand in one day, and more are pouring in. By next week it could be twenty thousand. Then they'll be overrunning our perimeter here. We can't wait. Our only security lies in pre- emptive attack. We will fight terror with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING ACROSS the grim faces of the miners and troopers Fear transforming to hatred in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next slide. This mountain stronghold is supposedly protected by their deity. When we destroy it, we will blast a crater in their racial memory so deep they won't come within a thousand klicks of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPERS issue automatic weapons and magazines to a long of mine workers. The miners lock and load like the red- blooded redneck NRA supporters they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLASTING TECHS are setting radio-detonated primer charges into two-ton stacks of EXPLOSIVE COMPOUND. The stacks are band-strapped together on pallets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING WITH SELFRIDGE, staring around him in growing di as he walks through the full-scale mobilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches Quaritch, who is barking orders amid a hive activity around the ampsuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is completely out of control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch ignores him, turning away to focus on ordnance loading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I am not authorizing you to turn the mine-workers local into a freakin' militia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I declared threat condition red. That puts all on-world assets under my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can pull this palace coup shit on me?! I can have your ass with one call --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quaritch grabs him and PINS him against the side of an ampsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a long way from Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selfridge is paralyzed. Physical force -- against him? Quaritch releases him and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men) Get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several troopers converge on Selfridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch me you're so fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes through them and they escort him toward the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUMAN JAKE, NORM and TRUDY are gathered around the comms monitor, talking to MAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how secure this channel is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's crazy here, Jake. It's full mobilization. They're rigging the shuttles as bombers. They've made up these big pallets of mine explosives. It's for some kind of shock and awe campaign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frickin' daisycutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Max) Can you talk to Selfridge? Maybe we can cut some kinda deal before this thing goes all the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Quaritch has taken over. He's rolling and there's no stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh six hundred tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake takes that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max signs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's gonna commit those bombers straight to the Well of Souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Because I gave it to him on a plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he takes out the Well of Souls -- it's over. It's their main line to Eywa, to their ancestors -- it'll destroy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess we better stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks like he's about to collapse.   He's gaunt, eye deeply shadowed, hands shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get some rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a packet of freeze-dried crystals and pours them directly into his mouth, chewing them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna have to settle for coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING through the warrior camp above the Well of Souls Hundreds of hunters from many clans prepare their weapons

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunters paint the wings of their banshees like war ponies DIREHORSES are painted and ornamented with totemic stream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Na'vi paint and pierce themselves. Dance. Bathe in th smoke of cleansing herbs -- RITUAL PURIFICATION. HUGE DRU are beaten. A dark primeval energy. They are psyching themselves up for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a warrior who dreamed he could bring peace. But there was only one thing I was ever really good at. Ooh-rah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT -- Jake, Neytiri a group of banshee riders squat around an animal skin on which he has drawn the silhouett a Scorpion gunship -- like a hunt totem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Na'vi/subtitled) Strike here and here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake splats red dye at the centers of the circles symboli the rotors. The Na'vi absorb the lesson eagerly, like kid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees TRUDY approaching and breaks off. Neytiri stays w the hunters, talking about what they've learned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LOW) You know our chances suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up against gunships with bows and arrows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NODDING) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She taps his fist and walks away toward her SAMSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cook-fires of the battle camp FLICKER like a constellation around the edge of the Well of Souls as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE slips down into the darkened, empty amphitheater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the MOTHER TREE -- gnarled, ancient, MAJESTIC The roots spread in all directions, like the center of th world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake steps forward. The willow-like tendrils SWAY toward him, moving in a breeze that isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never done this in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squats at the base of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm probably just talking to a tree right now. But if you're there -- I need to give you a heads up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up into the tree. The hanging tendrils undulate softly. It's easy to imagine a presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Grace is there with you -- look in her memories -- she can show you the world we come from. There's no green there. They killed their Mother, and they're gonna do the same thing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM UP IN THE TREE, looking down.   WOODSPRITES float in silence, moving around aimlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Sky People are gonna come. They're gonna come like a rain that never ends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neytiri approaches silently behind him, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- until they've covered the world. Unless we stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (cont'd) Look, you chose me for somethin'. And I'll stand and fight, you know I will. But I could use a little help here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake senses Neytiri and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Great Mother does not take sides. She protects only the balance of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes to him, intertwining her long fingers with his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was worth a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lean in, foreheads touching, bodies pressed together Holding each other -- in this, the last moment of peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a turbine as it starts to turn. Its RISING WHINE carries over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAGAZINES are slammed into automatic weapons. AMMO BELTS fed into rotary cannons. MISSILES are attached to gunship stub-wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON BLUE HANDS sharpening wooden arrows.   Stringing bows. Cinching direhorse harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROOPERS DROP into ampsuit cockpits. PILOTS close gunship canopies. TROOPERS run up shuttle ramps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS STACK, tight and abstract on gunships as they r in a swarm amid boiling turbine exhaust and blasting roto wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT -- TILTROTORS fill the sky. Deadly armored beet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRAGON leads the formation, flanked by SCORPIONS. Beh that is a wave of SAMSONS, and last, the two enormous VALKYRIE shuttles, packed with troops and ampsuits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE DRAGON, Quaritch surveys his armada as they sk over the tree tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY SWEEP toward the Hallelujah mountains in a thunderin wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQUADRONS OF BANSHEES darken the sky in waves, led by a single GREAT LEONOPTERYX. Jake sits astride his mount, flanked by Neytiri and Tsu'tey on their banshees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRAGON DESCENDS on final approach to a large clearing the LZ. The Samsons flair and touch down, disgorging troo while the gunships hover protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VALKYRIES blast the ground with their powerful lift j They land. The ramps drop. Troopers pour out, weapons leveled, advancing in a cordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ANGLE as AMPSUITS descend from the Dragon on cables. Their massive feet smash down, and they march forward, leading the army into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLE WAINFLEET, walking point in his hydraulic suit, scan his cockpit screens. He sees movement on the FLIR display ghostly THERMAL SIGNATURES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact. Two hundred meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chilling SOUND echoes through the forest -- the ululati WAR CRIES of untold Na'vi. The troopers, look around, spooked. They can't tell where the sound is coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they feel it -- the GROUND ITSELF SHAKING.    They g their weapons, bracing themselves as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE HUNDRED NA'VI HORSEMEN charge through the forest at full gallop, their hooves POUNDING the earth. It is an awesome sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM SPELLMAN rides with the Na'vi hunters, carrying an assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NA'VI CHARGE thunders toward the human line.   The hu raise their bows as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE AMPSUITS raise their GAU-90's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE THERMAL IMAGERS target-cursors track the ghost rid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire for effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire line of troopers opens fire. TRACERS riddle th jungle, blasting foliage into confetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARGING DIREHORSES crash down, flipping over. Riders are flung off. The withering fire continues, and the ranks ar decimated as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIDERS LAUNCH their arrows at a full gallop. A few hit th marks among the troopers. NORM FIRES his AR on full auto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CHARGING DIREHORSES have a heavy log slung between th like a battering ram. At a full gallop they hit an ampsui FLIPPING IT onto its back with a blown-out canopy. Victor is short lived as the two riders are cut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORM'S HORSE is hit by tracer fire. He is flung off as th creature cartwheels. He hits hard, scrambling for cover a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WARRIOR HURLS his spear a moment before his horse is cu down. It SLAMS through an ampsuit's canopy but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MERCILESS FIRE continues. Horses rear and collapse. Riders pivot their mounts to flee and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THERMAL SCREENS show the remaining ghost riders scattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LYLE signals and the line advances, firing sporadically a moving targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD, NA'VI HUNTERS stream through the trees, running along the branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the troopers advance into bow range, the NA'VI open fi and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
